0.Description: This winery pipes Baroque music through their vineyards 24-7 and believes that the power of music positively influences the ripening process. Whether that sounds odd or it's music to your ears, we encourage you to taste for yourself to see if they're on to something. This Syrah promises dark berry fruit, floral notes and savoury spices. At this price, it's serious wine for a song.

Purchased by Jean-Pierre Moueix in 1953, Château Trotanoy is home to dense gravel-on-clay and clay-on-iron soils that are difficult, yet rewarding, to cultivate. A selection of gravel-based parcels on the northeastern part of the estate has been dedicated to Espérance de Trotanoy, a wine that is fruit-forward and approachable after just a few years of cellaring. Produced in limited quantities and only in certain years, it is vinified in small concrete vats and aged in French oak barrels.
If you simply must open this wine now, decant it for an hour or two and pair with rare roast beef or charcuterie and cheeses.
This wine, a blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cab Franc, has matured and taken on layers of dried and preserved fruit characters in the years since Parker's review, and is now at its peak drinking time.

0.Description: Gérard Bertrand began working with Clos d'Ora 1997 and only released the first wines (from the 2012 vintage) in 2014, when he felt that he was truly expressing the terroir of this remarkable site. The nine-hectare Clos d'Ora vineyard is enclosed by walls and farmed using biodynamic practices, including the use of mules and horses. The vineyard is planted to Syrah, Mourvèdre, Grenache and very old Carignan. Bertrand has said that Clos d'Ora represents a newfound focus for him: 'I turned 50 three months ago and I want now to make tribute wines. This is what I want to do for the next 30 years: to capture the essence of the terroir (thedrinksbusiness.com, April 9, 2015).'

0.Description: Bandol is one of the oldest wine-producing areas in Provence. The majority of the vines in Bandol are planted in terraces arranged across what is essentially a natural amphitheatre that faces the sea. The low man-made walls of the terraces are made of a type of river stone called restanques. The limestone, sandy maris and sandstone soils are best known for producing rosé, which makes up more than 60% of the wines here; red wine makes up around 30% of total production. All grapes must be hand-harvested. Red wines must contain between 50 and 95% Mourvèdre and must be aged for a minimum of 18 months. This one is 90% Mourvèdre with the remainder made up of Grenache. You will encounter impressive black fruit and pepper spice alongside Provence's distinctive herbal tones.

Winemaking in the Aloxe-Corton area dates back over 2,000 years, and one of the region's early fans was the emperor Charlemagne. The soils of Aloxe-Corton are limestone and clay on a marl subsoil, and the Pinot Noir tends to be intensely flavoured, with lifted berry fruit and firm structure. These are wines that deftly traverse the potential divide between structure and elegance.

0.Description: 'Quintarelli' is a name that is virtually interchangeable with 'superlative.' There are few names so revered, so truly iconic and so readily identified with quality, tradition and artisanal winemaking. The care, precision and, above all, the patience that goes into making the wines of Quintarelli play no small part in creating the legendary, almost mythical status that the wines own. The primarily old-vine Cabernet Franc Alzero is made using the appassimento technique, in which the grapes are dried before being pressed and made into wine. The style embodies the uncompromising perfection that lies at the heart of these phenomenal, concentrated, intensely flavoured handmade wines that routinely earn ratings in the 90-97-point range from many of the world's most respected critics.

0.Description: This is sourced from the oldest vines on the property and is then aged for a period of 24 months in barrel. This fairly recent addition to the Nipozzano portfolio was first made in 2011. 'The Vecchie Viti was a 'mistake,' a wine born of practicality and the specific characteristics of the 2011 harvest. According to Nipozzano's winemaker Eleonora Marconi, the 600-acre estate underwent a replanting program beginning in the 1970s. One 50-acre parcel of 40-year-old vines, still trained in the old Guyot method, remained to be replanted. Warm weather in August 2011 resulted in an early and relatively short harvest. The Vecchie Viti plots, harvested entirely by hand, were the last to be picked. Normally, the old-vine Sangiovese would be blended with the other lots for the Nipozzano Riserva. It was the last to be picked and lack of tank space prompted Marconi to ferment the old vines in cement. As the team tasted the different lots prior to blending, the wine from the old vines stood out, and the Frescobaldi team liked it and decided to age and bottle it separately.' (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, July 9, 2014). Look for an elegant, refined wine with impeccable fruit, spice and floral tones.

0.Description: Sonoma is a complex mosaic of soil types - more than in all of France - and diverse mesoclimates. The Russian River Valley has a long, cool growing season and experiences plentiful fog cover. These factors combine to make it excellent territory for Burgundian grapes. Pinot grown here has noted complexity and balance and impressive flavours, thanks to the slow ripening of the grapes. You can expect this to offer richly articulated dark berry with herbs, earth and mineral undertones. Enjoy with blackened mutton.

'Farconnet' was the name of a nobleman back in the time of Jean-Louis Chave's great-grandfather. This wine is sourced from vines on three distinctive parcels of the Hermitage hill. The majority comes from the pebbly Diognières, known for particularly spicy wines; Péleat, a sandy site, contributes finesse; and Greffieux, consisting of rolled river stones near the base of the hill, brings structure.

This is the second vintage of this single-vineyard Pinot from the Wismer-Parke Vineyard, which was planted in 1999 on silty clay and limestone.

Ageable 3-5 years, or enjoyable tonight with grilled steak or lamb. This is a winery to keep your eye on.

From one of the great Burgundy vintages and from one of the most iconic names in Burgundy, the renowned 'Lalou.' Jancis Robinson, MW, said of the 2005 vintage: 'If there is one dominant characteristic of these [2005] wines it is their thrilling combination of ripeness and acidity' (jancisrobinson.com, Jan. 27, 2007). And David Schildknecht says '... The personality of wines from this luminous, gloriously healthy and ripe vintage is positively kinetic, but decidedly on the dark side of the flavor spectrum. Fresh, sometimes faintly tart black fruits, overt and at times almost austerely mineral flavors, and mysterious, at times brooding forest floor complexities are the norm. Many of the best Pinots of 2005 push the limit of ripeness consistent with freshness, and the limit of sheer density consistent with elegance. Firm, fine tannins are never far from the surface, even where these Pinots' youthful textures are already silken or creamy. These wines will need time in the bottle to show their true colors ...'( robertparker.com, April 29, 2017)

0.Description: The latest vintage of Ornellaia's second wine is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot sourced from the estate's younger vineyards. Expect outstanding quality and longevity.

0.Description: The latest vintage of Ornellaia's second wine is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot sourced from the estate's younger vineyards. Expect outstanding quality and longevity.

0.Description: On January 15, 2012, the wine world lost one of its greatest artisans when Giuseppe Quintarelli passed away at the age of 84. He was a universally revered, iconic force in winemaking, and his wine-ageing regimen was among the most rigorous anywhere. He would not release a wine until it was ready, even if this meant waiting 10 years. For fans of Veneto wines, his were must-have expressions. His daughter Fiorenza, his son-in-law Giampaolo and his grandsons Francesco and Lorenzo now oversee production and continue his practice of extended ageing, ensuring the legacy of Quintarelli.

0.Wine Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Chobeo De Pecina Tinto De Autor

0.Description: The wines of Côtes de Bordeaux Castillon are all red, and the blends can include Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. The principal grape is Merlot, in large part due to the predominance of clay soils in the region. Supple, round and generous, these reds are noted for their red fruit tones and typically offer impressive strawberry, raspberry and cherry notes.

0.Wine Name: Salvatore Molettieri Vigna Cinque Querce Riserva 2008

0.Description: Even within a region as storied as Burgundy there must be places of even further distinction. Such a place is Gevrey-Chambertin, home to nine grand cru vineyards. It is from these sites that some of the world's most sought-after wines are created. Among the most intense and structured of all Burgundy reds, they are impressively full-bodied and ageable. The non-grand-cru wines of Gevrey-Chambertin, such as this one from the renowned Maison Leroy, carry significant reputations in their own right. This depth and breadth of quality has seen the area earn the moniker 'the King of Burgundy.' No mean feat, and very apt here, as the remarkable Marcelle (Lalou) Leroy, owner of Maison Leroy, is Burgundy's queen.

0.Wine Name: Domaine de Montille Beaune Les Perrières 1er Cru 2015

0.Description: The Hervé family can trace their history in this area to 1607. They have been producing wines here since 1890. This 2008 is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec that will offer a wealth of dark fruit with tobacco and herbs wrapped around a refined mineral core. Expect a wine with considerable vibrancy and drive.

0.Description: The grapes for this tasty, rich and polished Merlot were mainly sourced from the estate vineyard in Rutherford as well as select nearby growers. Aged for 18 months in both American and French oak, this wine features attractive cherry, blackberry, and toasty oak flavours. Exceptionally versatile, it pairs well with everything from pork tenderloin to grilled gourmet sausages to beef Wellington.

0.Description: This is the 375 mL version of our super-popular Essentials wine 656561.

This flagship wine is crafted from 100% Sangiovese selected from the estate's best fruit from their vineyards in Barberino Val d'Elsa in northern Chianti Classico. This is a wine made to age and one that will reflect a refined finesse over sheer power (though it has plenty of that, too). One of the defining characteristics of Cepparello has been its marked evolution and continued refinement vintage after vintage. Some of the advancements include allowing the wines to interact with more air during vinification and increasing élevage in oak from 12-14 months to 18-20 months. The 2014 vintage was rated 97 points by Antonio Galloni, who had this to say about the wine: '... Vivid and intense in all of its dimensions, it exudes purity from start to finish ... expressive aromatics and beautifully delineated ...' (vinous.com, Jan. 2018). Galloni gave a drinking window of 2024-2039.

0.Description: Buena Vista was founded in 1857 and was California's first premium-focused winery. The Sheriff honours founder Sheriff Agoston Haraszthy and is a blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Grenache. The 2015 vintage earned the Best of Class designation and a Gold Medal at the 2017 Press Democrat North Coast Wine Challenge.
Gold Medal winner at the 2016 National Wine Show of Australia.

The 2014 Equuleus is the follow-up to the much-lauded 2012. Equuleus is produced only in years when the grapes reach optimum ripeness and quality. Commentary and scores for the 2012 include 93 points from Rick VanSickle of winesinniagara.com, who called it '... smooth on the palate with generous fruit flavours, fine tannins and integrated spices that echo on the long finish.' Sara d'Amato of winealign.com awarded the 2014 92 points, saying, '... this incarnation is absolutely enveloping and offers a considerably plush texture ... A classic built to last with firm but not drying tannins.' Expect this 2014 to shine through. It was a difficult year for many, but Equuleus took it in stride.

0.Wine Name: Catena Appellation San Carlos Cabernet Franc 2014
0.Description: Iconic and innovative, the Catena family have always been leading lights in Argentina's rise. Their Appellation series is modelled after the Burgundy system where village names become synonymous with the distinctive wines produced there. For Catena, San Carlos means Cabernet Franc.

Rock Point makes their Pinot partly in oak and partly in stainless steel to emphasize the fruit character. Expect ripe strawberry, red cherry and raspberry and pair with duck, roast beef or tourtière.

0.Wine Name: Villa Maria Taylors Pass Single Vineyard Pinot Noir 2015

0.Description: There is a continued evolution in the Primitivo of Puglia: wines once known for their tannic, robust nature are now earning a reputation for greater refinement and finesse. An increased sophistication in the approach to winemaking, both in the vineyard and the winery, has given rise to wholly new expressions. This one falls into this modern caste and will offer you ripe black fruit and earthy notes with vanilla and spice. An ideal choice for meaty pasta dishes with tomato-based sauces.

0.Wine Name: Trapiche Terroir Series Finca Ambrosía Single Vineyard Malbec 2012

0.Description: This blend of Corvina and Merlot comes from a family operation that dates to 1895. You will find this to be an approachable, easy-to-enjoy wine with a modern sensibility. Expect lushly articulated dark fruit with coffee, spice and cocoa in support. This wine always delivers superb value. Try it with a charcuterie platter or grilled sausages.

This Primitivo (a.k.a. Zinfandel) spent 3+ months in American oak barrels. Expect a smooth, elegant wine showing plum and cherry jam character with sprinklings of cocoa and vanilla, and pair with your favourite pizza.

0.Wine Name: Jamieson Ranch Double Lariat Cabernet Sauvignon 2013

0.Description: This estate began producing wine in the 17th century. Pierre de Marsan was a descendant of the Viscounts of Marsan, founders of the town of Mont-de-Marsan in the Landes department. In 1630, he married a wealthy heiress whose dowry included a large property in Lestiac. Look for currant, plum and savoury herbal characters in this wine and pair it with lamb kebabs or grilled mushroom salad.

0.Description: Throughout their winemaking process, Twomey strives to have as little influence on the final wine as possible to encourage the emergence of each vintage's true provenance. To further this aim, they hand-sort their grapes, employ indigenous yeasts and move the wine through the winery with gravity rather than pumps. They ferment each lot separately before blending and careful ageing in French oak. This is a wine that will evolve for up to 10 years from harvest.

0.By:: Az. Agr. Case Basse Di Soldera Gian
0.Description: Gianfranco Soldera is a complicated and even controversial figure, but the bottom line is that his wines are outstanding and he is one of Italy's most influential winemakers. Choosing to label this wine as an IGT rather than as a Brunello di Montalcino may be confusing for some customers, but this is 100% Sangiovese sourced from the iconic Case Basse vineyard, planted in 1972. This remains one of the world's most sought-after wines. It was aged in barrel for 48 months and is the first vintage to be released following the vandalism that saw Soldera lose over 16,500 gallons of ageing wine dating from 2007 to 2012.

0.Description: The Mariani brothers, Andrew and Adam, founded Scribe in 2007 with an eye toward producing terroir-driven wines crafted with minimal intervention. This Pinot from Carneros is given the same level of attention to detail as their Estate Pinot. It's made with indigenous yeast and fermented in concrete or steel to preserve the grape's most delicate aromatic characteristics, then aged in neutral oak for six months. Expect a high-toned, soft, evocative wine with great balance, ripe fruit and earth tones. This wine is almost entirely allocated to the Scribe Viticultural Society (a.k.a. SVS), which is the official name for the Scribe wine club. This is a rare find.

0.Description: Séguret became a named village in 1967, but its history as a wine producer dates to 611, and it has been the location of dedicated winemaking since the 10th century. The wines of Séguret are notably structured, a perfect reflection of the steep hillsides in which they are grown. This will have a lifted lavender floral note and will offer concentrated red fruit with all the structure and depth for which the village is renowned.

0.Description: Situated at the juncture of the Sonoma Valley, Carneros and Napa Valley appellations, the estate vineyard of Gundlach Bundschu has been owned and farmed by the Bundschu family for over 150 years. They focus on creating small-lot, ultra-premium wines. The 2011 Merlot was sourced from the steep, southwest-facing hillsides of shallow, rocky soils of volcanic ash and alluvial wash in their over-150-year-old Rhinefarm estate vineyard. You can expect a lush and polished wine with concentrated fruit that will drink well for 5-10 years.

Pascal Marchand, formerly of Domaine Comte Armand and Domaine de la Vougeraie, and Canadian partner Moray Tawse now have 9 ha in Burgundy divided between Nuits and Beaune. Expect an elegant expression of red Burgundy showing raspberry and cherry fruit, and tuck this away in the cellar till 2020 to experience its full potential.

0.Description: When making high-quality wine, balance is key. Striking the fine line and crafting a wine that has impressive fruit ripeness and also freshness and clarity is no easy feat. The cool nights and warm, sunny days in Paso Robles help winemakers hit just the right note, and this Cabernet faithfully expresses this characteristic vintage after vintage. Look for great balance and structure, with ripe black fruit, vanilla, pepper spice and chocolate. A great option for grilled steak.

0.Description: Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Aragonez are just a few of the myriad native grapes responsible for the food-friendly red wines of Portugal. This 2015 comprises this popular trio of grapes, and you can expect them to impart their gifts of dark fruit, cherry and structured tannins with typical generosity and aplomb - and all at an amazing price. Try this with grilled pork ribs, or beef or lamb stews.

From Washington wine guru Charles Smith, this Syrah comes from a 30-acre estate vineyard over 365 metres above sea level, planted in 2012. The 2014 vintage of this wine earned a score of 95 points from Tim Fish of Wine Spectator and was ranked #2 on Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 2017 (winespectator.com, Aug. 21, 2017). Though not yet reviewed at time of publication, this 2015 will be every bit as stunning - Smith never takes a step back.

Packed with aromas of cassis, violets, tobaccos smoke, blueberry and mocha, this full-bodied red is cellar worthy with its solid structure and good backbone of acidity. The ripe fruit flavours are intense and concentrated. Enjoy 2007-2012.

0.Description: Cherry Avenue vineyard comprises three blocks named for the children of Moray and Joanne Tawse and is planted with Chardonnay, Riesling, Pinot Noir, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Carly's Block was planted with Riesling in 1976 and is home to some of the Niagara Escarpment's oldest Riesling vines. The vineyard's Pinot Noir is sourced from Robyn's Block (one acre, planted in 2002 and 2005) and David's Block (two acres planted in 2005). As the vines in the latter two blocks have aged, the resulting wines have also evolved and, with each vintage, demonstrate greater complexity and depth. You can expect this to be approachable and characterful with notes of red berry, herbs and licorice. Enticing with very pure mineral, red berry and aromatic herb aromas and flavours. A complex blend of local Venetian grapes matured in Slavonian oak, this wine is always popular with Vintages customers. Look for mocha, espresso, black olive and cherry aromas and flavours in a chiselled, precise frame. The Tedeschi family suggests pairing this with hearty soups, pasta, Mediterranean cuisine and white or red meats.

The estate-grown grapes are harvested by hand and the wine is aged in a combo of oak, stainless steel and concrete for 36 months. Expect a complex interplay of earthy, vibrant red fruit and forest notes, and savour over the next 10+ years with pasta bolognese, eggplant parmigiana or a grilled rib-eye steak.

0.Description: This is a wine that, year in and year out, successfully delivers a definitively Burgundian experience at a tremendous price. As an introduction to the wines of Burgundy, this is a rock-solid starting point and very hard to beat. For fans of the region, it will deliver the elegance and refinement of Burgundy with the requisite cherry, beet and earth tones. A fine choice for beef stew.

0.Description: Tedeschi makes this Ripasso with complexity in mind, which is why they blend Corvina, Corvinone and Rondinella grapes with the rare Rossignola, Oseleta, Negrara and Dindarella varieties. This wine spent six months in Slavonian oak barrels and a further six months in bottle before release. Expect layer upon layer of fresh and dried cherry, plum and spices, and pair the wine with pancetta risotto.

Kakheti is the most significant wine-producing region in Georgia and archaeological evidence suggests that wine grapes have been cultivated there for at least 8,000 years. This wine is crafted from two indigenous varieties, the white grape Rkatsiteli and the red Saperavi. Expect a wine with fresh red fruit flavours and a sweetness balanced by vibrant, zesty acidity. Enjoy with spicy Korean ribs, fruit pies or churchkhela (traditional Georgian candy made with grape must, nuts and flour).
Please note that because of the limited quantity available for this product, it will be released to only a limited number of stores. Please check vintages.com for listings.

Wakefield is the name used in North America by Australia's eminent Taylor family. Their Clare Valley Shiraz will offer great depth and richness with ripe blackberry, blueberry, black pepper and chocolate. Pair with lamb.

Blending across regions allows winemakers to combine the unique attributes of both - in this case, the intense, ripe cassis and dark fruit of the Clare Valley and Coonawarra's silky feel and mint flavours. This wine is a longtime favourite with Vintages customers who love its consistent rich dark fruit, chocolate, spice and mint. Grill some lamb chops and serve with mushrooms and mint sauce.

This one is a consistent performer and never fails to deliver impressive dark fruit, spice, smoke and leather. This is a wine to steal your heart, especially when paired with beef stew or beef brisket.

0.Description: This Appassionato is created in a similar fashion to the great Amarone wines of Veneto. 'Graticcio' is the term for the traditional racks used for air-drying grapes after the harvest. It is this drying that concentrates the flavours in the grapes and allows for the creation of more concentrated, robust wines with notes that include dried fruit and toasted almonds. Tommasi have long been recognized as masterful proponents and represent the modern face of this ancient technique.

0.Description: Twomey sources the grapes for their Merlot from their Soda Canyon Ranch, which is situated on volcanic soils in the southern part of the Napa Valley. This part of Napa experiences early morning fogs, which helps preserve freshness and drive as rich dark fruit flavours evolve. During the ageing process, the wine is racked from barrel to barrel in the classic Bordeaux technique known as soutirage traditionnel. This process helps round out the tannins in the wine, producing Twomey's characteristic softness and richness while also elevating the wine's aromatic character.

0.Description: Sometimes 'super' runs in the family. Le Serre Nuove is the little sibling of the famous Supertuscan Ornellaia, and is a powerhouse in its own right. It's a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot grown in Tenuta dell'Ornellaia's younger vineyards. Expect a rich tapestry of fresh currants, dark cherry, meat, vanilla, chocolate and woodsmoke. Savour over the next 10-12 years with red meats and black truffles.

Emilia-Romagna has long been regarded as the source of some of the best foods Italy is known for - parmigiano reggiano cheese, prosciutto di Parma and Modena balsamic vinegar, to name a few. The reputation of their wines is now catching up to that of their food. The historic Umberto Cesari estate has been a major player in establishing the IGT Rubicone appellation. For more than 50 years, Umberto Cesari has represented a standard of quality that simply cannot be denied or ignored. This customer favourite is a blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet and is perennially a supple wine that unveils a complex, textured array of lush dark fruit, coffee, herbs and smoke, with just a hint of rustic charm. A good match for roast meats.

It's built to last a decade or more, but will impress tonight with firm cheeses or red meats.

0.Description: Gérard Bertrand has virtually spearheaded the drive for terroir-based expressions from the South of France. Seeking to reveal the finest that the varied, distinct regions and subregions have to offer, his efforts have redefined and revitalized the reputation of the entire South of France and have catapulted places like Fitou to the fore of viticultural attention. The wines of Fitou are typically excellent value, generous and robust with spice and clove tones mixed in with the fruit. They can age well and often need 3+ years after vintage to show their very best.

The village of Binyamina is named for Baron Edmond Benjamin James de Rothschild, a major benefactor to the Israeli wine industry in the late 19th century. He established a perfume factory in Binyamina in 1925; isn't it sweet that this building would eventually become one of Israel's leading wineries? Expect a rich, balanced wine with pronounced notes of red fruit and fresh herbs. Ready to enjoy now with the producer's suggested pairings of grilled vegetables or pesto gnocchi.

0.Description: Rutherford Wine Company is family-owned and family-farmed, and their strong connection to their roots is reflected in the Lander-Jenkins name. Reese T. Jenkins, who ranched and farmed in Lander, Nevada, is the great-grandfather of Rutherford's general manager. The Lander-Jenkins line is crafted to be fruit-forward and food-friendly, and you can expect just that from this wine. The 2015 Cabernet is sourced from premium vineyards across California, including Napa Valley. A great wine for barbecue season, especially if sliders and ribs are on the menu.

You can expect a balanced and expressive wine with rich cherry and dark fruit tones, herbs and notes of toast and cloves. An ideal pairing for peppered lamb medallions.

A blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot grown in schist and sandstone marl, this Chianti Classico spent six months in 50 hL casks before being transferred to variously toasted French oak barriques for a further six months aging. This is crafted with food in mind, and the dark fruit, spice and herbal tones you will encounter here will be a fine match for barbecued lamb shoulder chops with rosemary and thyme.

It'll be big, flavourful and supple, and will be equally delicious with burgers or quesadillas.

0.Description: 'Telteca' is the Huarpe word for 'ripe fruit,'' a descriptor that suits the Roble Bonarda to a T. Floral, ripe and juicy, with impressive red and purple fruit, spice, refined tannins, superb balance and integration and a long, elegant finish. There's a neat Canadian connection here as well: The Agostino family moved to Canada in the '60s, but the Agostino brothers never forgot their time working the vineyards of Mendoza with their grandfather and returned there in 2003 to open Finca Agostino. Telteca is their second label.

This one, sourced from the famous Sangiacomo Vineyard, underwent open-top fermentation with indigenous yeast. 0.Description: Small but mighty, Prince Edward County is a gem of a region, made all the more impressive and special by the range, quality and refinement of the wines crafted by so many excellent wineries. Closson Chase, which is one of the region's pioneering premium producers, is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2018. Pinot specialist Keith Tyers has been the winemaker since 2015, and his terroir-focused approach seeks to make the connection between the soil and the glass obvious to all who enjoy his wines. Look for an elegant, perfumed wine with energetic cherry, red fruit, spice and earth. Enjoy with grilled pork or salmon.

0.Description: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano was called 'the perfect wine' in 1549, the 'king of wines' in 1685, and had 'noble' incorporated into its name in the late 18th century. This one is made from 90% Prugnolo Gentile (Sangiovese) with 10% Canaiolo, spent 24 months in oak casks and offers smoky notions of violets and red cherry that will be familiar to fans of Brunello and Chianti. Pour it with osso buco, or sautéed chicken in a marinara sauce.

But let's scan the clues ... L'Expression de Margaux happens to be a brand marketed by a company called Ulysse Cazabonne, based in Margaux and owned by the luxury fashion house Chanel. Guess which famous Margaux estate Chanel also owns? Château Rauzan-Ségla, an elite 'second-growth' property on Bordeaux's Left Bank, producer of one of France's most sought-after reds.' 0.Description: Late-season barbecues have a different feel than a traditional summer barbecue. Summer barbecues are fun - they're supposed to be - but September or (fingers crossed) October barbecues feel like rewards. This popular California Merlot, sourced from vineyards in Napa, Sonoma and Monterey, is the ideal choice for these extended innings. Smooth and easy-to-enjoy, this wine has dark cherry, vanilla, chocolate and smoke tones that make it a genuine crowd-pleaser.

Burrowing Owl Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
0.Description: Burrowing Owl gives a hoot about sustainability. In fact, they're a leader in eco-conscious winemaking in the Okanagan Valley. They've installed banks of photovoltaic solar panels on their property to provide their own sustainable energy, and their solar water-heating project is so successful that they've literally got more hot water than they know what to do with in the winery (their solution: use the excess to heat a swimming pool for lucky visitors). Their Cabernet is consistently big and impressively structured with layers of red fruit, dark fruit and oak spice.

0.Wine Name: Sergio Zenato Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2012
0.Description: A blend of 80% Corvina and 10% Rondinella with dollops of Oseleta and Croatina. Grown in the oldest vineyards in the Costalunga estate in Sant'Ambrogio di Valpolicella, the fruit for this wine was dried for 3-4 months in small trays before pressing took place in January 2013. The juice then rested on the skins for 15-20 days before the vinification, after which the wine aged for 48 months in Slavonian oak barrels. Expect a rich, complex wine just approaching its peak maturity.

Monica Larner awarded this wine a rating of 93 points and suggested a drinking range of 2020-2030, citing a '... laser focus and a precise delivery of aromas that makes an immediate and satisfying first impression ...' along with '... subtle tones of ash and crushed mineral ...' (robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

0.Wine Name: Rubinelli Vajol Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2011

0.Description: Weather in Ontario's 2015 vintage was a bit chaotic, particularly early in the growing season, but old vines - such as the Pinot Noir vines used to make this wine, which were planted in the 1980s in dolomitic limestone interspersed with clay - are so deeply rooted as to not even notice such trifles. Expect rich, brambly berry fruit, earth, mineral and wisps of oak, and pair the wine with beef bourguignon or seared duck breast with braised mushrooms.

0.Description: This year marks the 135th anniversary of Wente Vineyards, making it the oldest continually operated family winery in the United States. Their Zinfandel contains 20% Petite Sirah for added depth and texture and was fermented partially in stainless steel and partially in oak to achieve the desired balance of fresh fruit and oaky richness.

Château Ksara is Lebanon's oldest winery (they celebrated their 160th year in 2017) and the country's largest. Ksara has developed a strong following here at Vintages, and this consistent, popular Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah blend has played a significant part in strengthening that relationship. Look for a ripe wine with plenty of cassis, cherry, blackberry and spice.

From the 2001 vintage, described by Jancis Robinson, MW, as '... a vintage that has long been overshadowed by the more famous 2000, and to begin with was lumped together with the 2002 as one of the weaker vintages of the beginning of the new century. But over the last two or three years, all my tastings have suggested that 2001 is generally much better than 2002 and can in some instances show better than the equivalent 2000 ...' (jancisrobinson.com, April 2, 2011). Expect this to offer an impressive insight into mature Bordeaux, with dried fruit, spices, herbs, leather and earth notes.
Silver Medal winner at the International Gamay Competition 2018.

0.Description: TASTING NOTE: Selected from the oldest vineyards in the area of Manduria and Sava, this wine delivers notes of dark fruit, plum, spice and earth. A vibrant core of acidity keeps this feeling fresh. Enjoy with barbecued back ribs or a lamb stew. (Vintages panel, Jan. 2018)

0.Wine Name: Masi Mazzano Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2012
0.Description: The Boscaini family keeps a unique collection of fine wines in its private cellars; wines that are produced in limited quantities and only in the best years. Mazzano, the epitome of classic Amarone, is a serious, superb wine. The grapes come from the eponymous vineyard, famous for the quality of its produce since the 12th century, and are laid out in traditional drying lofts during the winter months. Expect impressive intensity and complexity and raise a glass to Amarone maestro Sandro Boscaini during this, his farewell-tour year.

0.Wine Name: Famille Perrin Nature Côtes du Rhône 2016
0.Description: Long-time leaders in organic winemaking, the Perrin family - who own Château de Beaucastel - are one of the most recognizable and highly respected wine families in the world, and their wines are among the most popular at Vintages. This wine offers tremendous value, and you can expect it to deliver an impressively layered, complex array of dark fruit and berries, with smoky and savoury undertones. Enjoy with grilled meats or lamb stew.

TASTING NOTE: Soft and approachable with stewed blackcurrant, ripe mixed berries, sweet spices, mint, smoked meat and toasty oak. Lovely, creamy texture. This will be a fantastic pairing for duck confit with berry compote. (Vintages panel, Feb. 2018)

0.Description: The wines of Côtes de Bordeaux Castillon are all red, and the blends can include Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. The principal grape is Merlot, in large part due to the predominance of clay soils in the region. Supple, round and generous, these reds are noted for their red fruit tones and typically offer impressive strawberry, raspberry and cherry notes.

Founded in 1978, Zaccagnini makes wines that are immediately recognizable on the shelf: they are the ones with the small piece of grapevine cutting attached to the neck of the bottle. As for what's in the bottle, expect to encounter ripe dark fruit, blackberry, cassis, cedar and spice. This will be a reliable food wine that will work with meaty pastas or smoked meat platters.

0.Description: Stags' Leap is one of California's oldest wineries. Winemaking began here in 1893, and through Prohibition and California's quality winemaking boom of the 1970s the graceful, powerful, elegant wines of this historic estate have remained a touchstone. This highly collectible Cab will be floral, savoury and earthy with herbs, ripe cassis and black fruit. A superb gift for the wine lover on your list, it will also make a classy addition to your own cellar.

Burrowing Owl marked their 25th anniversary in 2018. Their Meritage is always a pure, complex expression of the five principal Bordeaux grapes: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. It will deliver impressive ripe dark fruit, oak and coffee notes in a balanced, structured package. John Szabo, MS, of winealign.com awarded both the 2013 and 2014 vintages a score of 92 points, citing the wine's concentration and density in both years. Of the 2014, he said it was '... not more than a stylistic stone's throw from many of Napa's finest'; a measure of the excellence of both this wine and the celebrated winery behind it.

TASTING NOTE: From fourth-generation winemakers Marc and Elodie Milhade, this is fruit-forward and approachable with notions of dark cherry, plum, smoky oak and a sprinkling of white pepper. Excellent value here in Saint-Émilion Grand Cru. It'll sing with hearty stews featuring lamb, root vegetables and bacon or lardons. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2017)

0.Description: TASTING NOTE: This blend of Syrah, Grenache, Carignan and Mourvèdre comes from specially selected vines between 30 and 80 years of age. There's good depth and concentration to the flavours here, with ripe red fruit, vanilla, dried orange peel and earth tones. A great value, this wine has the breadth to be a fine match for anything from a charcuterie platter to a roast beef dinner. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2017)

0.Wine Name: Capraia Effe 55 Gran Selezione Chianti Classico 2013

0.Description: Luca Maroni awarded this wine 94 points. (lucamaroni.com, 2018)  The term 'Governo' indicates that this wine was produced using a technique that dates to 14th-century Tuscany. The Governo process calls for the setting aside of a portion of the grapes from the harvest to be partially dried. These grapes, and more importantly their concentrated sugars, are then added to the must of the main portion of wine, triggering a new fermentation. This second fermentation produces drier wines with even more intensity and depth. The technique can also result in softer, more rounded wines. This example will be great with roast beef or grilled sausages.

1.Description: Henry of Pelham is one of Ontario's most trusted and beloved of producers. This Chardonnay is always an elegant wine crafted to emphasize focus and precision. It features bold, ripe fruit with vanilla, smoke, buttered toast and a creamy, long mouthfeel. A refined example of Ontario's prowess with Chardonnay. Try this with grilled pork ribs or grilled lobster.

A real crowd-pleasing Chardonnay that shows there's more to New Zealand than Sauvignon Blanc. Apple, melon, lemon and well-handled oak - a model for trendy cool-climate Chard. Oysters are an obvious match, but try with sautéed fish or grilled pork chops.

Straw yellow; floral, peach & melon fruit aromas; dry, medium-body, with nut, apple & citrus fruit flavours.
Pale straw; toasty, oaky, apple & tropical fruit aromas; dry, buttery, fruity & well balanced with a clean finish.

Cave Spring's fine Rieslings have won much international acclaim. This one, from vines that are 20+ years old, features peach, grapefruit, floral and stony mineral flavours. Shines with turkey burgers, cassoulet or baked ham.

This fresh, fruity wine is a popular take on Peninsula Riesling. One of the most alluring traits of Riesling is the grape's ability to provide a precise reflection of where it's grown - cue the mirrored label and narcissist tag. This typically rides the line between dry and off-dry, delivering bright citrus fruit tones alongside pear and apple, as well as the distinct, defined mineral note that is so present in Ontario Riesling. Very versatile - you can enjoy this as a sipper or paired with spiced curries.

1.Description: VINTAGES releases thousands of wines each year, and this is consistently a top seller. It put Pinot Grigio on the map with its refreshing green apple, peach and citrus notes. A favourite with a plate of antipasti, grilled chicken or seafood salad.

1.Wine Name: Kourtakis Apelia Moschofilero White Peloponnese IGP
La Vieille Ferme Cotes du Luberon White AOC

1.Description: Light yellow; melon, pear & citrus aromas & flavours; dry, medium-bodied with clean citrus finish.

1.Wine Name: Woodbridge By Robert Mondavi Sauvignon Blanc

1.Description: Tropical notes of pineapple and banana plus buttercream, caramel and smoke. This is a smooth, creamy Chardonnay. Bonterra's organic practices help express the vibrancy of the fruit. Pair with grilled shrimp, chicken tourtière or lobster with butter sauce.

1.Wine Name: Pelee Island Blanc de Blanc VQA

1.Description: One hundred percent barrel-fermented Chardonnay with the richness one wants from California. Plenty of sunny fruit and lively freshness. Creamy and round with notes of buttered toast and tropical fruits. Try with char-grilled corn on the cob, or with grilled chicken.

Popular Oyster Bay hails from the Marlborough region, ground zero for classic New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Expect notes of expressive lime, passion fruit, kiwi fruit and fresh-cut grass. Pair with sea scallops pan-fried in butter with asparagus on the side.
Delicate apple, ripe asian pear & lemon aromas & flavours; extra-dry, with a well balanced acid structure.

1.Wine Name: Pelee Island Late Harvest Vidal VQA

1.Description: 'Toasted Head' means the whole barrel was toasted, giving the wines more intense smoky flavours. This Chard has apricot, tropical fruit, grilled pecan and smoky apple-cinnamon flavours. Pair with barbecued shrimp kebabs or stuffed pork tenderloin.

If you haven't yet experienced the dazzling wines of BC's Okanagan Valley, this is a striking introduction. A juicy Chardonnay loaded with flavours of pear, melon and creamy toffee. Sings with pasta alfredo, grilled eggplant sandwiches or baked chicken.

Chardonnay is this sustainable winery's specialty, and this one is superb. It sports complex baked apple, caramel and toasty oak flavours with a mineral-laced finish. Pair with fish and chips, pasta primavera or roast turkey with all the trimmings.

1.Wine Name: Lurton Piedra Negra Pinot Grigio Organic
Woodbridge By Robert Mondavi Pinot Grigio

1.Description: An exquisite example of cool-climate Chardonnay, this favourite features tropical fruit, roasted hazelnut, citrus and butter. Serve with grilled salmon, Camembert with crusty bread, or stuffed pork tenderloin.

1.Wine Name: Casillero del Diablo Reserva Sauvignon Blanc

1.Description: For 10 generations, the name 'Henri Bourgeois' has been synonymous with passionate precision winemaking. The clay and limestone ridges of Chavignol evoke classic gooseberry, grapefruit and fresh herb tones. Try this with scallops, oysters or tuna steaks.

1.Wine Name: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Sauvignon Blanc

1.Description: From fifth-generation winemaker Charlie Wagner, this rich Chardonnay is famous for its lemony freshness, its ripe tropical fruit notes framed by oak-imparted buttered toast and vanilla tones and its balancing bright acidity. Ideal for lobster tail or turkey pot pie.

Lively with white flowers, citrus, melon and green apple, this Chardonnay comes from one of New Zealand's most iconic producers. Makes a mouth-watering sipper, or enjoy with grilled seafood or chicken.

Chardonnay has travelled the world, but it's at its best in its true home: Burgundy. This expertly crafted version delivers yellow apple, citrus and lime zest with a kiss of oak. Enjoy with chicken in a mushroom sauce, trout with tarragon butter or turkey.

Fans of Soave will love this wine -- it's made with the same grape (Garganega) and it's intense and complex, with exotic aromas of lavender, toast, peach and pineapple. A suave match for pasta in creamy pesto sauce, sushi or risotto with pork tenderloin.
Available at select VINTAGES locations.

1.Wine Name: Pelee Island Tailwind Gewurztraminer Riesling VQA
Concha Y Toro Frontera Sauvignon Blanc

1.Description: A food-friendly, great-value Chardonnay from one of Ontario's most lauded new wineries. There are loads of tropical fruit, pear, cinnamon spice and oak all perfectly balanced by fresh acidity. Will match everything from chicken Caesar salad to grilled crab.
Aromas of citrus and peach with floral notes; dry, light & crisp with pleasant flavours of lemon/lime & grapefruit.

1.Wine Name: Malivoire Guilty Men Riesling Sauvignon Blanc VQA
Laurent Miquel Pere Et Fils Chardonnay d'Oc

1.Description: Fermented in stainless steel at cool temperatures to preserve maximum freshness and vibrancy, this characterful, textured charmer has an alluring soul and will offer crisp apple, tropical fruit, melon and pear. Try it with grilled seafood or roast chicken.

1.Wine Name: Peller Estates Family Series Chardonnay VQA
1.Description: Medium straw; floral, apple, lemon & oak aromas; dry, crisp with green apple & pear flavours.
Available at select VINTAGES locations.

1.Description: Old vines (vieilles vignes) produce less fruit, so the wines are more concentrated and flavourful. This classic, steely, Chablis features aromas of sweet apple, mineral and citrus. Ideal for grilled white fish, as well as oysters on the half shell.

1.Description: Straw green; apricot, citrus aromas & flavours with floral, mineral notes; off-dry, with refreshing acidity.

1.Wine Name: Strewn Two Vines Riesling Gewürztraminer VQA
Château des Charmes Sauvignon Blanc VQA
1.Description: Pale straw; intense lime & gooseberry aromas & flavours, with hints of pea pod; dry, finish is clean & refreshing.

1.Wine Name: Henry Of Pelham Sauvignon Blanc VQA
1.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery
1.Description: This youthful Savvy is bursting with aromas and flavours of binned apples, lime, fresh grass, and flinty mineral notes. Crisp and refreshing, it has a lively streak of acidity, and a lingering finish. Enjoy it as an aperitif, or serve it up with steamed clams and mussels, or grilled squid.

1.Wine Name: Pelee Island Lighthouse Sauvginon Blanc VQA

1.Description: Think Riesling is always sweet? Think again. Rieslings from Alsace, like this classic, are often bone dry. This features aromas and flavours of lime juice, peach and mineral. The ultimate food wine. Pair with grilled shrimp and pesto pasta, or gourmet sausages.

1.Wine Name: G. Marquis The Silver Line Chardonnay
1.Description: The Stone Road Vineyard's soil warms quickly and holds heat during the day, yet cools just as quickly at night. This assists in ripening the grapes while maintaining freshness and preventing the development of unbalanced flavours, making this wine possible. A wealth of buttered toast, pineapple, peach, toast and oak spice. Perfect for grilled pork or chicken.

Susana Balbo has been called the 'Evita of Wine' and the 'Queen of Torrontés.' Her Crios Torrontés is floral and fruity with apple blossom, peach, orange citrus and lime. Argentina's signature grape will work with smoked meats or seafood.

This iconic Napa expression is intense with a rich mouthfeel. It features toast, vanilla and roasted fruit tones along with ripe, bright apple, melon, lemon zest and tropical notes. The addition of roughly 15% Semillon adds a gorgeous silkiness to the texture. An intriguing classic, it will have good versatility at the dinner table and will work equally well with turkey dinner or grilled fish.
Pale straw; floral & grassy aromas; dry, light-body, with gooseberry and citrus flavours & finish.

This is a super-popular Chardonnay from the coastal region of Monterey. It's bursting with banana, mango, grilled pineapple and smoke flavours. Delightful with grilled salmon steaks, butter chicken, or smoky prawns with green-mango salad.

1.Wine Name: Giesen Vineyard Selection Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
Peller Estates Family Series Dry Riesling VQA
The Wolftrap Viognier Chenin Blanc Grenache Blanc

1.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

1.Wine Name: Villa Maria Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc 2017

1.Description: James Suckling awarded this wine 88 points: 'Light apples and pears. Light body, some fresh acidity and a simple finish. Drink now.' (jamessuckling.com, March 16, 2018)

1.Wine Name: Casas del Bosque Reserva Sauvignon Blanc
1.Description: Founded in 1993, Casas del Bosque was one of the first wineries in the cool Casablanca Valley. Bright, lively and wonderfully aromatic, this offers suggestions of kiwi, lime zest and an exciting hint of jalapeno. Pungent and versatile, enjoy on its own, or with grilled fish or smoked salmon.

Founded in 1876, Beringer is California's longest continually operating winery. This Chardonnay is vivid and focused with tropical fruit, lemon, pear, toasty spice and zesty acidity. Creamy and round, this will be ideal for buttered lobster.
Floral with lime, lemon, nectarine and mineral notes. Complex and pure with excellent weight and texture. A precise and exquisite Ontario Riesling. Great with spicy Asian foods.

Oyster Bay has long been a flag-bearer for New Zealand premium wine. Their PG is zesty and juicy with generous peach, lime, grapefruit and minerality, and falls between the Alsatian and Italian styles. Enjoy with grilled pork.

1.Wine Name: Bodega Norton Barrel Select Sauvignon Blanc
Peller Estates Family Series Chardonnay VQA
Long Weekend Wine Co.Chardonnay Pinot Grigio VQA

1.Description: This popular, classic Mosel Riesling is always a superb value. It's made with a gentle sweetness that is kept in balance by Riesling's firm natural acidity. You can expect to find lemon, apple, peach and touches of tropical fruit alongside the pure minerality that is such a defining characteristic of the Mosel. Pair with a spicy Thai pork dish, or breaded calamari and jalapenos.

1.Wine Name: Burning Kiln Harvest Party White VQA

1.Description: This wine is grown in Sonoma Coast vineyards that vary from clay-loam near San Pablo Bay to rocky ridges along the Pacific coastline. It's consistently a deep and complex Chardonnay that pairs well with grilled pork or seafood.

1.Wine Name: Villa Maria Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc
Rodney Strong Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc
Big House The Birdman Pinot Grigio

1.Description: This comes from the Okanagan outpost of one of the leading lights of Canadian winemaking: the one-and-only Ann Sperling (director of winemaking and viticulture at Southbrook in Ontario). Beppi Crosariol (The Globe and Mail, July 10, 2017) awarded the 2015 version of this wine a rating of 91 points, calling it '... medium-bodied, tight and tense with acidity, just enough to accentuate the apple-, pear- and peach-like fruit ...' and a '... Genuinely cool chardonnay.' You can expect the 2016 to reflect similar quality and traits.

1.Description: The McManis family succeeded in having River Junction designated as an AVA in 2001. This is one of the few California appellations that is home to a single producer. The tiny pocket that makes up River Junction is situated at the confluence of the San Joaquin and Stanislaus rivers and is on average 2-5 degrees cooler than neighbouring areas, which imparts a distinct freshness and vitality to its wines. This Chard will be soft and round, with apple, pear and peach tones atop a buttery note. Good for roast bird or grilled pork.

The natural rock formation that surrounds the area creates an almost perfect suntrap that helps the grapes to ripen, giving more fullness and intensity to the wine. Wines from this appellation are popular in Parisian bistros and cafés and pair beautifully with a wide range of foods. The producer suggests pairing this one with sausages, shellfish, quiche, or grilled chicken or pork.

Founded in 1891, Wynns is one of Australia's most iconic and important wine estates. Coonawarra is Australia's southernmost wine region and is almost as famous for its unique terra rossa soils as for its wine. Cool ocean breezes make this region ideal for Chardonnay and Wynns has been producing this classic, intense and fruity expression since 1981. Look for a flinty affectation here, as well as a fine use of oak. This will be a great pairing for grilled chicken or shrimp.

1.By:: Sandhi Wines Llc Dba Sandhi Wines

1.Description: 'Talon White is a captivating blend of Auxerrois, Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Viognier, Savagnin, and Sauvignon Blanc. Compelling aromas in the glass invite a taste. Intriguing and intricate citrus fruit and flowery notes balanced with lively acidity that supports a long finish. A great sipping wine!' (Gary Killops, eatdrink.ca, Jan. 5, 2015). This wine was the winner of a Gold Medal at the 2015 Finger Lakes International Wine Competition.

1.Description: This is sourced from four vineyards, two in Napa County (Twomey Calistoga Estate Vineyard and the Oakville Estate Vineyard) and two in Sonoma County (Merino Estate Vineyard and Twomey Healdsburg Estate Vineyard). The grapes are selected to reflect the best of each vineyard - the Napa grapes bring intensity and tropical flavours while the Sonoma grapes impart zest and minerality - and are fermented separately to preserve each site's unique stamp. The final blend delivers a complex, balanced Sauvignon Blanc with great breadth, refinement and versatility.

You can expect this 'wild' ferment Viognier to be a richly-textured wine with notions of white petals, peach, lemon and grapefruit citrus aromas and flavours, and some underlying tropical fruit tones. A nice option for lake fish.

Look for subtle notions of white peach, yellow cherry, citrus and blanched almond in this consistently complex and impressive offering from iconic producer Fontanafredda.

1.Description: Before he was a winemaker, Charles Smith spent nine years managing rock bands and concert tours throughout Europe. His time in Italy inspired his Vino wines, which include a Pinot Grigio, a red Cabernet/Sangiovese blend and a Sangiovese rosé. This PG sings with peach and citrus flavours, and it will make a fine pairing for grilled seafood.

1.Description: This family-run estate was established in 1850, and the grapes used to produce this 2016 were sourced from vines 30-45 years of age. Look for classically articulated notes of mineral, pear and apple on the nose and palate with a dynamic freshness and lift. Alain Geoffroy's Beauroy is noted for the particular clarity and precision it achieves. Enjoy with seafood.

1.Wine Name: Remoissenet Père & Fils Beaurepaire Santenay 1er cru 2015
1.Description: The Beaurepaire premier cru vineyard is found on the steep slopes at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune, bordering on the Côte Chalonnaise. Unlike most of the vineyards of the Côte d'Or, whose vines face south-east, the grapes planted in Beaurepaire enjoy a virtually direct-south-facing aspect, guaranteeing superb sun exposure providing them with excellent prospects for ripening. The result is that these wines tend to offer a more robust character. The vineyard produces both Pinot and Chardonnay, and the relatively large size of the vineyard allows for a wide range of style and interpretations. Look for a wine with a round and balanced feel that suggests peach and nuts with a hint of spice.

1.Wine Name: Roche de Bellene Les Charmes Meursault 1er Cru 1999
1.Description: 'Nineteen ninety-nine was a gift from the Gods: a vintage both plentiful and successful: not only of high quality but consistent geographically and hierarchically ... Harmony is the key to longevity. When it is supported by good structure, the time-span, the window of opportunity, can be much more extended than we expect. All good reds of a good vintage, plus most of the whites of premier cru level and above, require ten years to show their paces. This is very true of the 1999s. As you will see, there are very few disappointing wines. To those who possess stocks of the vintage, I say: yes, you can start drinking, but don't be in too much of a hurry to empty your bins. There are plenty of bottles which will still be in a vigorous prime in 2019.' (Clive Coates MW, clive-coates.com, 2009)
In its native New Zealand, The King's Legacy is dubbed 'The King's Bastard.'

1.Description: The Rodney Strong Sonoma County Chardonnay is perennially accessible and easy-to-enjoy, which has made it a real customer favourite here at Vintages. Typically ripe and round with impressively articulated fruit aromas and flavours wrapped up in a nice tidy package that delivers consistent quality and value. A hit with richly textured seafood dishes, this is a wine that will have a broad appeal, making it an easy choice for any crowd or entertainment need.

The terres blanches soils give the wine power and a smooth mouthfeel, while the caillottes soils provide it with fruit and aromatic finesse.

These are ripe, round wines with suggestions of walnuts, almonds and apricot. They are notably balanced and vibrant. This botrytis-affected wine will be ideal with nuts, dried fruit or blue-veined cheeses.

The wines of the Bâtard-Montrachet Grand Cru tend to be richer and more perfumed than those of its neighbours, Montrachet and Bienvenue-Batard-Montrachet. This is due to the vineyard's positioning lower on the slope of the Mont-Ratchet hill, where the soils are somewhat deeper and more fertile. However, this is a very relative comparison, as the soils of Bâtard-Montrachet are by no means generous, and the roots must work hard in this stony, steep site. This wine will be complex, fruity and mineral driven.

1.Description: This is sourced from clay-limestone soils in the southern part of Marsannay, which is itself the northernmost area of the Côte de Nuits. The grapes were harvested as whole bunches from vines that average 40 years of age. Fermentation is achieved using indigenous yeasts. The wine is then aged for 16 months with no racking or stirring - this preserves the wine's minerality. Some 30% new French oak was used to inflect delicate oak tones. You can expect this to be a complex, fruity wine with apple and pear fruit accented by gently applied oak.

Typically crafted to be more overtly aromatic than most PGs, the Pighin is always bright, refreshing and light, perfectly tuned for pairing with a wide range of seafood or grilled chicken dishes.

1.Description: Domaine Faiveley is one of the largest and most illustrious domaines in Burgundy. It was founded in 1825 in the village of Nuits-Saint-Georges under Joseph Faiveley, a wine merchant with a passion for travel. In the early 19th century, trade had begun between Burgundy and northern Europe, predominantly along the rivers and canals connecting the two regions. Merchants from Burgundy would travel along these paths to exchange their wines for textiles. Joseph Faiveley was one of these merchants, introducing his Burgundian wine to the world. Today, the house is run by seventh-generation Erwan Faiveley. The wine is grown in limestone-and-clay soil, harvested by hand and aged 14-16 months in oak.

Moray Tawse, famed for his multi-award-winning eponymous Niagara winery, is at the forefront of a new wave of vignerons and micro-négociants who embrace organic and biodynamic farming practices. 'I was very impressed by the quality of these wines,' says wine critic Neal Martin. 'Very intense, detailed and unapologetically very terroir specific (robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016).'

The vineyards of Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru les Embazées are situated on the southern border of the Chassagne-Montrachet appellation. With a long natural fermentation and ageing in oak barrels, this wine packs a powerful punch. Considered one of the wines of the year in the 2018 French wine guide book Bettane & Desseauve, it is described as (translated from French) 'fleshy, generous, very long, complex, very fruity, embodies the spirit of Chassagne with a mix including, full body, precision and freshness. Drink now through 2025.'

Bouchard Père & Fils Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru 2015

1.Description: Château La Nerthe has a notably modern style to their wines, yet they manage to maintain a refined sense of provenance that imparts the wines with a classic familiarity. This is a blend of 52% Grenache Blanc, 35% Roussanne and 13% Clairette and is typically crafted to offer a sharp, focused, taut, linear impression. You can expect to encounter deftly articulated white flower tones atop lemon, melon, spice and smoke, with a mineral-accented finish.

1.Description: TASTING NOTE: The EastDell Estates Black Label Viognier 2014 was the only Canadian wine awarded a Gold Medal at the 2017 Six Nations Wine Challenge, which features the very best wines from six New World wine producers. It's a floral, juicy wine with apple, peach and orange pith, a gorgeous round mouthfeel and a great finish. Enjoy with spiced pork, or seafood mains. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2017)

Vermentino di Sardegna is an appellation for wines made from the Vermentino grape variety grown on the stunningly beautiful Italian island of Sardinia, where it's typically picked early to retain its vibrant acidity. The Mediterranean climate means that bright, crisp white wines such as this are quite popular on the island - and they're perfect for summertime here, too. Look for crunchy orchard fruit, citrus and floral notes and pour the wine, lightly chilled, alongside fregola or couscous with asparagus and lemon.

A touch of bitterness on the crisp finish adds another excellent dimension to the experience. Give this a go with a seafood stew. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2017)

Kamptal is home to many of Austria's most concentrated versions of Grüner Veltliner. Loimer is a particularly respected winemaker, and you can expect this wine to offer great intensity and fruit purity with fresh acidity, fine balance and a characteristic spice note. The wines crafted by Loimer are wines of distinction that deliver tremendous freshness and are easy to enjoy. Try this with smoked ham or smoked salmon.

The sun-soaked, ocean-cooled, coastal Monterey region does an almost magical job of creating big, plump Chardonnay that retains its balancing brightness and liveliness. This example serves up luscious tropical fruit nicely matched by toasty oak. It'll go well with pork burgers hot off the backyard grill.

1.Description: Capable of producing fine wines in every style across the board from bone-dry to lusciously sweet, Chenin Blanc has been delighting wine lovers for more than 1,300 years. This is a refined example of a charming off-dry Vouvray. Ripe and fresh with a vibrant acidity, this will offer impressive peach, pineapple, and lemon citrus tones. The residual sugar here makes this ideal for spicier dishes such as grilled spicy Korean ribs.

1.Wine Name: Cave de Turckheim Brand Pinot Gris 2012

1.Description: The volcanic soils of the Fattoria di Fiorano vineyards are planted to Merlot, Cabernet, Semillon and Malvasia di Candia. Founder Alberico Boncompagni Ludovisi, who inherited these lands in 1946, has employed organic agriculture from the very beginning, rejecting the post-war trend toward the false miracle of chemical interference in the vineyard. This spirit of traditional winemaking continues to this day. Look for this 100% Semillon to deliver intense, complex fruit with toast, butter and vanilla undertones. This is crafted to reflect an elegant, characterful wine - and keep an eye out for that refined volcanic minerality.

Burgundy's most celebrated vigneronne, Madame Bize-Leroy, is a living legend, with a career spanning an astounding 62 vintages. Lalou, as she is affectionately known, began overseeing the family négociant business, Maison Leroy, in 1955 when her father turned his focus to running Domaine de la Romanée-Conti. There are few winemakers in the world with as celebrated an understanding of the nuances of terroir, and fewer still as capable of crafting wines that demonstrate such defined articulation. Her tenacity and relentless pursuit of quality permit no compromise. Her wines are a definitive declaration of the spirit of Burgundy.

The 86-year-old dynamo Lalou Bize-Leroy has been a legend in Burgundy for over six decades and her reputation for precision and quality is second to none. Hers are some of the most highly sought of all Burgundian wines - which, of course, is really saying something. If she was impressed enough to include this amongst her négociant stable of wines, you can be confident it will be outstanding.

1.Description: The village of Monthélie falls between Volnay to the north and Meursault to the south. The village is home to 15 climats that have earned premier cru designation. Though the area is best known for producing reds, Chardonnay has become increasingly important in recent years. The majority of white Monthélie is produced at the southern end of the village and shares some similarities with the great whites of Meursault. Refined acidity, white flowers, lemon, apple and hazelnut are typical expressions found in Monthélie's Chardonnays.
