Jean-Max Roger La Côte de Bué Sancerre 2014
1.Description: This wine is a true labour of love. It took the Roger family 25 years to nurture these historic vines on the Bué coast back to health. The result is a mineral-driven, wonderfully complex Sancerre.

1.Wine Name: William Fevre Bougros Chablis Grand Cru 2015
Gini Contrada Salvarenza Vecchie Vigne Soave Classico 2014
1.By:: Gini Sandro E Claudio Soc. Agr. Sem

1.Wine Name: Marchesi di Barolo Gavi di Gavi 2016
Moselland Goldschild Single Vineyard Riesling Kabinett 2016
1.Description: This wine received a score of 90 at Mundus Vini 2017.

1.Wine Name: Villa Maria Cellar Organic Sauvignon Blanc 2016
Maycas del Limarí Limestone Coast Reserva Especial Chardonnay 2016
Hervé Azo Vau de Vey Chablis 1er Cru 2015
Brutocao Bliss Vineyard Estate Bottled Chardonnay 2016
1.Description: This wine received 90 points from Wine Enthusiast (June 2018).

This is certified for sustainability and integrity and was sourced from west-facing slopes of Simonsberg Mountain, planted at some of the highest altitudes in Stellenbosch. At 550 metres, the grapes benefit from altitude but also from the cool ocean breezes that flow in from False Bay and Table Bay. These cooling influences allow for a crisp, fresh wine that characteristically offers impressive gooseberry, asparagus and passion fruit. Lively and refreshing with a spine of food-friendly acidity, this will be a fine choice for grilled shrimp.

McManis succeeded in having their vineyard in the River Junction recognized as its own AVA, citing the unique mesoclimate in which it was situated. This Viognier typically offers vibrant fruit and touches on the tropical and orange citrus end of the scale. It's a proven sipper, but you can expect the versatility for pairing with dishes like pan-seared fish or grilled tuna steak.

1.Wine Name: Bourillon Dorléans La Coulée d'Argent Sec Vouvray 2015
Kim Crawford Wild Grace Small Parcels Chardonnay 2016

1.Description: This is the half-bottle size of our Essentials product (106450) that is the customer favourite of customer favourites here at Vintages. A refreshing, lively companion for lighter cheeses or seafood appetizers. You'll love the lemon citrus, apple and peach notes.

1.Wine Name: La Monacesca Mirum Riserva Verdicchio di Matelica 2014
Mas des Bressades Cuvée Tradition Blanc 2017
1.Description: The Mar' family began making wine in Algeria during the early 20th century and would later acquire properties in Bordeaux (Château Puy Castéra) and in Costières de Nîmes, where they founded the renowned winery that produces this wine. This heat of this region is offset by cool breezes from the Petite Camargue: the large river delta where the Rhône River meets the Mediterranean. The whites here tend to be quite ripe, with a range of tropical fruit flavours.

1.Wine Name: Left Field Hawkes Bay Pinot Gris 2017
Château Saint Nabor Côtes du Rhone Blanc 2017
Flat Rock The Rusty Shed Chardonnay 2016

1.Description: The words 'aus der steillage' on this wine's label translate as 'from the steep slope,' which, if you've ever seen the crazy-steep vineyards along the Mosel, is certainly appropriate. 'Feinherb,' meanwhile, is a term on German labels indicating that a wine is off-dry. This 2017 Riesling from Peter & Peter Zeller offers ripe pear and melon fruit with the characteristic mineral undertone for which Mosel Riesling is so renowned. The subtle sweetness will make this a good option for spicier dishes such as pad Thai.

1.By:: Casale Del Giglio Az. Agr. Srl

1.Description: From a popular producer, this 100% Viognier was grown in clay and limestone. Expect plenty of peach, pear and apple, lovely aromatics and a rich texture. A perfect wine for lobster or white fish, with the crisp acidity to pair with cream sauces.

1.Wine Name: Paul Anheuser Schlossböckelheimer Königsfels Riesling Kabinett 2016
1.Description: This vineyard boasts impressive volcanic soils, which is a feature that marries beautifully with Riesling's noted ability to precisely articulate provenance. Together, these factors provide the mineral backbone of this wine. The residual sugar will make this a great match for a wide variety of spicier foods, but it will have the range for grilled sausages, pulled pork, grilled ribs, or seafood appetizers with a spicy dip.

1.Wine Name: Lucien Le Moine Corton Les Grandes Lolières Grand Cru 2015

1.Description: A fine example of Ontario Gewürzt. You can expect this to play all the correct notes, offering floral tones with suggestions of tropical fruit and lychee, with a mineral underpinning. The palate will be balanced, crisp, lush and round, with a citrus edge to the replays.

1.Wine Name: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Gold Label Chardonnay 2016
1.By:: Francis Ford Coppola Pres Rosso & B
1.Description: This is a perennial favourite that never fails to deliver ripe apple, melon and smoke, with touches of evocative floral notes at the edges. Easygoing and pleasing, it's a great barbecue wine and always makes a good impression.

1.By:: Coteaux Da Murta Bucelas Soc. Unipe

1.Description: Jolivet crafts Sancerre of notable depth and heft. Other defining characteristics are the purity of fruit and expressive minerality for which it is so well loved. Expect Jolivet's ability to strike a brilliant balance between texture and vibrancy to be on display here. Characteristically bright and lively with a pronounced minerality - look for flinty tones - this wine always provides a telling insight into the region.

1.Wine Name: Henri de Villamont Morgeot Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru 2015

1.Description: Cloudline was founded in 2002 by Burgundy standouts the Drouhin family. Under the watchful eye of Véronique Drouhin-Boss, this Pinot Gris is crafted in a style that reflects the bolder Alsatian take on the grape. You will encounter a fruity wine with suggestions of peach, melon, citrus and spice. It's always crisp and generous, with enough zest to be a delicious sipper. It will also be a fine choice for seafood appetizers or mains.

TASTING NOTE: 'Saint-Véran' is a must-know name for both fans of white Burgundy and those who are curious. The wines are noted for their value and their pure minerality. Saint-Véran lies to the north and south of Pouilly-Fuissé and shares much in common with this storied region. This Chard is loaded with lemon citrus, apple, peach, pear and spice, with a hint of vanilla. Creamy and appealing, with a crisp soul and a spine of refined minerality. This will be perfect for herbed chicken, or salmon steaks. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2017)
Crafted in a Chablis style that is anchored upon minerality. Rich and lithe with peach and apples and a long, rich finish. Perfect for seafood.

1.Wine Name: Harvey River Estate Sauvignon Blanc Semillon 2017
Henri de Villamont Prestige Bourgogne Chardonnay 2015
1.Description: In his June 2017 Gothic Epicures newsletter, wine writer Dean Tudor awarded this wine 88-90 points.

Named for the practice of burying vines to protect them during the winter, Buried Cane sources the grapes for this Chardonnay from across the Columbia Valley. Expect this to be a richly textured, floral wine with notes of buttered toast, apple, pear and vanilla. A nice option for grilled chicken or smoky pulled-pork sandwiches.

Duckhorn has been producing world-class Sauvignon Blanc since 1982. They include some Semillon in the final blend (about 16% this time around), and a portion of the Sauvignon Blanc is barrel-fermented. Both these steps add greater complexity and depth to the final wine. Look for a crisp wine with a vibrant, fresh finish and tones of ripe apple, peach and pear, with tropical fruit and grass notes and an appealing mineral quality. A great match for grilled salmon or other seafood.

1.Wine Name: Grgich Hills Fumé Blanc Dry Sauvignon Blanc 2015
Pascal Jolivet Le Chêne Marchand Sancerre 2015
Di Meo Alessandra Fiano di Avellino 2010
Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt Scharzhofberger Riesling Kabinett 2015

1.By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

1.Wine Name: Château de Tracy Mademoiselle de T Pouilly-Fumé 2016
Anne de Laweiss Collection Pinot Gris 2016
1.Description: This value-priced Pinot Gris will be impressively layered and elegant, with a silky texture. Expect nuanced fruit and spice notes and the versatility to pair with a wide range of foods - try it with chicken pot pie, veal or grilled tuna steaks.

Sauvignon Blanc from Sancerre, with its piercing flavours of gooseberry and nettle with stony undertones, has been a staple of the top restaurants of Paris for decades. The style is a classic match for goat cheese, and the producer suggests you could also pair this consistently brilliant example with seafood, white meats or sharp cheeses.

1.Wine Name: Bellingham Homestead Series The Old Orchards Chenin Blanc 2016
Schiopetto Blanc de Rosis Collio DOC 2016
Benjamin Leroux Château de Chassagne-Montrachet Baudines 1er Cru

1.Description: You can expect this blend of Chardonnay and Macabeo to deliver a wine of intense freshness and lift. Look for brightly articulated apple, pear, tropical fruit, orange citrus and floral tones with an underlying flinty minerality. This will be a great wine for grilled lake fish or lemon-dressed pork dishes.

1.Wine Name: Fleuron de la Rebourgère Sur Lie Muscadet Sèvre et Maine 2016
Valley of the Moon Pinot Blanc/Viognier 2015
Sue-Ann Staff Loved by Lu Riesling 2016
2017 Villa Maria Cellar Selection Pinot Gris
Casa de Paços Loureiro e Arinto 2016
Simi Russian River Valley Reserve Chardonnay 2014
Cantarutti Pinot Grigio Friuli Colli DOP 2016
Château de Béru Pinot Gris Maceration 2016
Invivo Graham Norton's Own Sauvignon Blanc 2017
Balthasar Ress Hattenheimer Schützenhaus Riesling Kabinett 2016

1.Description: This is typically a rich, robust style of Pinot Gris that bears virtually no resemblance to the less textured and weighty versions from Italy. You will find this to be smooth, generous, intensely flavoured and dry - though nudging the edge of off-dry. Elegant, vibrant and fresh with a wonderfully textured mouthfeel, it will be a great pairing for grilled shrimp with a mildly spiced dipping sauce.

1.Wine Name: Livio Felluga Abbazia di Rosazzo DOCG 2015
Santa Julia Pinot Grigio Del Mercado
Quinta Da Lixa Aromas das Castas 2017
Domaine de la Pinte Savagnin Ouillé 2013
1.By:: Societe Viticole Du Domaine De La P

1.Description: The 2016 vintage saw an early bud break, and warm temperatures continued through the spring and early summer. Nights trended cooler than is typical for July and August, and this allowed the grapes to retain freshness as they ripened. Expect lifted, sharply detailed apple and pear and vibrant acidity in this Chablis-style wine. Look for the minerality and bright flavours of Monterey, Santa Barbara and San Luis Obispo, as well as the richness and depth of Napa fruit. Always an impressive, sophisticated wine.
Natalie MacLean gave this wine a rating of 90 points. (nataliemaclean.com, Dec. 8, 2017)

Pouilly-Fumé may not be as readily identifiable for Sauvignon Blanc fans as its next-door neighbour, Sancerre, perhaps in part due to confusion with Burgundy's Pouilly-Fuissé. But it is a place you should know. This wine is always fresh and zesty with impressive fruit, bright citrus and a gorgeous minerality. As with many of Pouilly-Fumé's wines, this one will continue to evolve for at least 3-5 years. Try it with seafood or oysters, or simply sip and enjoy.

1.Wine Name: Borthwick Vineyard Paddy Borthwick Sauvignon Blanc 2017

1.Description: Made by the Wyse family, this Chardonnay was awarded a Silver Medal at the 2018 Pacific Rim International Wine Competition (that's Pacific Rim the locale, not the movie - the wines are not judged by giant robots). Expect ripe citrus and orchard fruit with subtle tropical fruit and oak notes, and pair the wine with lobster tail or pork chops.

Moscato d'Asti is a sweet, lightly fizzy wine traditionally enjoyed chilled as an aperitif, with creamy cheeses or other appetizers, or alongside fresh fruit at dessert. According to winemaker Stefano Chiarlo, the 2017 vintage in Asti was 'characterized by a long, dry summer where precipitation was scarce ... Nivole from this vintage is rich in aromas and taste with a moderate acidity, maintaining its renowned freshness and elegance.'(michelechiarlo.it)

1.Wine Name: La Griffe Bernard Chéreau Sur Lie Muscadet Sèvre et Maine 2017
1.Description: This perennially charming wine has earned a special place in the hearts of Vintages customers who admire its notes of floral blossoms, citrus, crunchy apple and marine stones. The classic pairing for Muscadet is mussels, which would work wonderfully here. Served chilled, it will also go nicely with a salad of grilled fiddleheads and artichokes.

Pinot Gris is one of Oregon's great gifts to wine lovers and is a focus for Elk Cove. The estate has vines dating to 1985 - among the oldest in Oregon. This one is hand-harvested from hillside vineyards situated in the north of the Willamette Valley. You can expect a long, balanced wine with juicy melon, pear, apple, tangerine and a refined minerality. It will be great with scallops.

1.Wine Name: Cape Town Wine Co. Sauvignon Blanc 2017

1.Description: Made with the signature Swiss white wine grape, Chasselas, which is known for its food-friendly crispness and subtlety. This wine is specifically created to pair with classic cheese fondue. It'll also go with ham quiche, chicken cordon bleu, or pierogi with onions and garlic.

1.Wine Name: Domaine de la Vieille Cure Muscadet Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie 2016

1.Description: A Gold Medal winner at Mundus Vini 2018, this wine will pair perfectly with grilled seafood.

1.Wine Name: Novas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc Organic

1.Description: 'Austria's widely planted grape variety produces an assertive, steely, rich dry white with a unique aroma and flavour. For some it hints at white pepper and celery, while others prefer the descriptors of gherkins and dill. Either way, there's often an unusual, alluring herbiness in what, at its best, can be an excellent, steely dry white.' (decanter.com, Jan. 2016)

You will find this to be crafted in a fresh, elegant style. Look for impressive initial floral tones that move into tropical fruit - think banana, pineapple and lemon. It will be sleek and refined with a pulsing natural acidity that drives the flavours and brings marvellous balance. Try this with grilled chicken, grilled seafood, or a smoked crab appetizer, perhaps?

This Riesling is sourced from select sites planted in steeply terraced vineyards; temperatures in the Wachau are moderated by both the Danube River and cool Atlantic breezes. Crafted in a dry style this will demonstrate characterful lime, pear and peach notes with superb balance and freshness. A great option for prosciutto platters.

1.By:: Casal Do Paco Padreiro, Sociedade V
Mixed Nuts, Llc Dba Argot Wines

1.Description: The Studert-Prüm family have been making wines in Wehlen for 12 generations and are a staple of the Mosel. This elegant, sophisticated Riesling comes from the steep, rocky blue slate of the Wehlener Sonnenuhr vineyard. Roughly 80% of the vines are planted on original rootstock, and the wine is produced using natural yeasts. This exceptionally age-worthy wine will provide a classic refinement and vibrancy with superb fruit and mineral intonations.

1.Wine Name: Ferraton Père & Fils Les Mandouls Condrieu 2016
La Crema Russian River Valley Chardonnay 2016
1.Description: The Russian River Valley experiences some of the coolest, foggiest conditions in the state and as a result has a long growing season. This allows the grapes time to fully ripen and develop great complexity of flavour without sacrificing freshness and vibrancy. The region is home to some of the finest Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays produced in California. This Chard will offer ripe tropical and citrus fruit with the AVA's famed intensity and balance. A fine choice for grilled lemon salmon.

1.Wine Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Indian Wells Chardonnay 2016
Zonin Classici Pinot Grigio Aquileia DOC 2017
Rocca Di Montemassi Calesole Vermantino DOC 2016
Livio Felluga Terre Alte Rosazzo DOCG 2016
Southbrook Vidal Skin Fermented White Orange Wine 2017

1.Description: Named for Sofia Coppola, this Chardonnay brings intensity and elegance in equal measure. Expect a viscous texture delivering ripe, slightly honeyed orchard fruit with delicate oak shading.

1.Wine Name: Castello della Sala Cervaro della Sala 2016
1.Description: This winery's name honours the Monaldeschi della Cervara family, who was the historical owner of Castello della Sala in the 16th century. The wine itself, made by the iconic Marchesi Antinori and first produced in 1985, blends Chardonnay with the indigenous Grechetto grape and is one of the first Italian white wines to have malolactic fermentation and maturation take place in oak barriques. Look for an elegantly robust wine showing crunchy orchard fruit.

The first vintage of this perennial favourite was produced in 1974. Year after year, Jermann's rocky, sandstone-rich vineyards in the Alpine foothills contribute a dynamic, distinctively mineral character that underscores crisp citrus and orchard fruit. James Suckling awarded the past six vintages of this wine 90 points or higher; expect great things from this newly released 2017 vintage.

The grapes for this wine are sourced from three vineyards that each reflect the nuanced differences in soil types. The Narvaux vineyard, which provides most of the grapes, is on a steep slope and planted in gravelly limestone soils. The Crotots vineyard is predominantly clay with a limestone base and some gravels. The Grand Charrons is very gravelly with limestone and clay and very fertile alluvium soils. The resulting wine will be an elegant, floral, vibrant expression of Meursault, with delicately applied oak.

1.Wine Name: Craggy Range Te Muna Road Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc 2017
Bott Geyl Pinot Gris GC Furstentum 2010

1.By:: Sociedade Da Casa Agricola Da Quint
Ashwood Estate Pty Ltd Trading As S

1.Wine Name: Klein Constantia-Pascal Jolivet Metis Sauvignon Blanc 2016

1.Description: TASTING NOTE: This wine is sourced from a single vineyard block and grown in limestone and gravel soils rich in fossil deposits. It's beginning to show some age both in terms of colour and flavour, but it's still impressive, with superb complexity and depth. Beautiful orange marmalade notes lead a parade of apricot jam, peach, honeycomb, toffee, orange citrus and spice. Great balance, texture and body with a long finish. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2017)

1.Wine Name: Domaine Besson Vaudésir Grand Cru Chablis 2015

1.Description: This is the négociant label of the Vincent family, owners of Château de Fuissé. From one of Burgundy's warmer regions (Pouilly-Fuissé), this Chardonnay balances elegance and opulence. Expect peach, baked apple and spice notes and a satisfyingly robust mouthfeel. A good choice for turkey dinner, it'll also pair with chicken breasts cooked sous-vide and then browned in a marinade of flour, white wine and butter.

1.Wine Name: Donatien Bahuaud Les Grands Mortiers Vouvray 2017
1.Description: This customer favourite is a regular sight on our shelves and is typically crafted to be a classic expression of off-dry Vouvray. You can expect a lifted, lean wine with pear, peach, candle wax and a driving acidity. From an estate founded in 1929.

Gold Medal winner at the 2017 Concours de Vins Macon.  Expect this classy wine to offer up notes of orchard flowers with peach, lemon and lime. It will be dry and crisp with a vibrant acidity. Enjoy with poached white fish.

1.Wine Name: Baron de Hoen Réserve Pinot Gris 2016
1.Description: TASTING NOTE: The 2016 vintage of this popular Alsatian Pinot Gris is balanced, soft and spicy with deftly articulated fruit tones. Try this classic with grilled pork. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2017)

1.Wine Name: Saint-Roch Vieilles Vignes Côtes du Roussillon 2017
The Tragically Hip Ahead by a Century Chardonnay 2017
Ponte de Lima Vinho Verde Adamado 2017
Serge Dagueneau Pouilly-Fumé Clos des Chaudoux 2016
Serge Dagueneau et Filles Pouilly-Fumé Tradition 2017

1.Description: TASTING NOTE: This is a more intense take than one may expect from Pinot Blanc. The nose is mild with just a hint of reduction, but the palate really shows this wine's mettle. Floral, tight and precise, this has superb vibrancy and plenty of lemon citrus tones. This will be great with salmon but has the presence to mix in well with a ham or turkey dinner. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2017)

Speaking of Assyrtiko, Jeanne Thexton said the following: 'This unique Greek grape is rising from relative obscurity, with an insider cult following, to achieve a resonant new voice in the wine world.' (Decanter, Jan. 12, 2016)

1.By:: Brenn-O-Kem Pty Ltd Trading As Wave
Les Grands Chais De France S.A

1.Wine Name: San Pietro Gavi DOCG Il Mandorlo 2016
1.By:: Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.

1.Wine Name: Tenuta del Buonamico Viognier IGT Toscana
Estreia Loureiro White Grande Escolha Vinho Verde 2017

1.Description: Gold Medal winner at Decanter World Wine Awards 2018.

1.Wine Name: St. Andrieu Blanc Cotes De Provence 2016

1.Description: Gold Medal winner at the 2018 National Wine Awards of Canada.

1.By:: Mixed Nuts, Llc Dba Argot Wines

1.Wine Name: Château des Charmes Paul Bosc Estate Chardonnay 2015
Gavi del Comune di Gavi DOCG 2017
Château Bellerive Quarts de Chaume Grand Cru 2015
Moselland Vanguard Pinot Grigio Blue Bottle
Moselland Ars Vitis Riesling Hockey Scene Bottle
Marcel Cabelier Chateau Chalon Vin Jaune 2009
1.By:: Les Grands Chais De France S.A

1.Wine Name: Casal de Ventozela Avesso Vinho Verde 2017
Rolet Côtes du Jura Blanc Expression du Terroir 2011
Estreia Alvarinho Loureiro White Colheita Selecionada 2017
Deiss Gruenspiel Le Jeu des Verts 2012

1.Description: TASTING NOTE: The aromas from this wonderful white jump from the glass. Bright apples, tropical fruit, cream and spice in a refreshingly pure and elegant style of Chardonnay. It's just lovely on the palate, with broad flavours, balanced spice notes, clean fruit and racy acidity. Such wonderful vibrancy and balance from start to finish. Score: 92 (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Dec. 16, 2011)
Though James Suckling suggests drinking this wine now, this is a wine that typically has a drinking window of 5+ years from harvest.

1.By:: Ashwood Estate Pty Ltd Trading As S
1.Description: Estate-grown and selected from several sites with different row orientation, the state of the art Pellenc harvester delivering flawless berries. Free-run juice chilled, wild yeast, cool fermented in tank, and kept on lees for 4 months to successfully build mid-palate texture without compromising its drive and length. The only gold in the sauvignon blanc class at the National Wine Show '16. Drink By: 2017. Special Value. (Score: 95, James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Jan. 1, 2017)

1.Wine Name: Jackson-Triggs Niagara Estate Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc 2013
Château de Puligny-Montrachet Les Poruzots Meursault 1er Cru 2015
Lanciola Vin Santo Chianti Colli Fiorentini DOC 2008

2.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

2.Description: Pale red; aromas of cherry, herb & black pepper; dry, light-bodied, with citrus, cranberry & earth flavours.

Hawkes Bay is one of New Zealand's oldest wine regions and classic Bordeaux varietals do exceptionally well there. This rosé is made from Merlot and Malbec and will offer ripe apple, strawberry, watermelon and tangy citrus notes. Perfect for summer salads or grilled seafood.

2.Wine Name: Ogier Cotes Du Ventoux Rose AOC
Woodbridge By Robert Mondavi White Zinfandel
Cono Sur Bicicleta Pinot Noir Rosé

2.Description: Malivoire is a local leader in sustainable winemaking. Fresh, zesty and bursting with red cherry and wild strawberry, this popular rosé defines 'food-friendly.' Refreshing with charcuterie and olives, goat cheese on endive or baked ham.

2.Wine Name: Terres De Saint Louis Rose Varois En Provence AOC
Big House The Siren Vin Rosé

2.By:: Francis Ford Coppola Pres Rosso & B
2.Description: Named for Francis Coppola's daughter, Sofia, this elegant and lively pink wine offers notes of flowers, strawberry, cherry, grapefruit and spice. Perennially popular, this wine will be available in Vintages all summer long. Chill and sip or pair with salmon.

A blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha, this pink wine is made in a bold style with great depth and structure. Look for intense strawberry and savoury herbal notes and pair with hearty, flavourful summer fare such as grilled pork or lamb kebabs, or grilled red peppers stuffed with ground beef, sharp cheese and paprika-spiced rice.

2.By:: Cantina Di Ruvo Di Puglia Soc. Coop

2.Wine Name: Tenute Sella Majoli Coste Della Sesia Rosato 2016
Hex Vom Dasenstein Pinot Rosé Sekt Dry 2014
Pink House Wine Co. Rosé VQA
Sue-Ann Staff Fancy Farm Girl Foxy Pink
2.Description: Sue-Ann Staff, recipient of the 2018 Tony Aspler Award of Excellence for contributions to the Ontario wine industry, makes this off-dry pink wine using a blend of 95% Riesling and 5% Cabernet Franc. Chill and sip it with your favourite soft and creamy cheese, spicy fish tacos, or grilled sausages topped with kimchi.

2.Wine Name: Mimi en Provence Grande Réserve Rosé 2017
Mas Des Cabres Estive IGP Rosé 2017

2.Description: The lead grape in this blend is the rare Négrette, which is found mostly in Fronton. It first appeared there in the 12th century and is believed to have originated in Greece. To create the 2017 Château Bellevue La Forêt Rosé, Négrette was blended with Cabernet Sauvignon, Gamay and Cabernet Franc. You can expect a fresh, fruity wine with a complex array of red and black fruit in a balanced, vibrant package. It's a great option for grilled salmon or chicken.

2.By:: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'ile de Saint-Tropez

2.Description: The grapes for this wine were sourced from some of Flowers's top sites, including the Sea View Ridge Vineyard. Expect this to be quite an elegant, fresh wine with superb cool-climate zest. Look for grapefruit and strawberry tones with nuanced rose petal and orange citrus and a pure mineral note. It's a great food wine - try it throughout the meal.

Winemaking at Château de Berne dates back over three centuries, but the site itself has been part of the winemaking history of Provence for far longer and dates back to the Romans. Expect a juicy, fresh, tangy rosé with floral tones, generous red fruit and a mineral heart - a wine filled with the sunshine and vibrancy of Provence. Sip with ham sandwiches or mild cheeses.

2.Wine Name: Château La Négly La Natice Rosé 2017

2.Description: Sommelier Wine Awards 2018 Gold Medal winner.

The Perrin family (of Château de Beaucastel) are true wine royalty and their dedication to precision winemaking shines across their portfolio. This Réserve Rosé is crafted from Cinsault, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah sourced from the Grand Prébois vineyard. The dry conditions in 2017 (the driest in 30 years) reduced yields but produced grapes of increased concentration. This rosé will have intense strawberry, raspberry and floral notes with characterful herbal suggestions. Perfect for grilled chicken breast.

2.Wine Name: Gassier Le Pas du Moine Sainte-Victoire Rosé 2017
Southbrook Triomphe Organic Cabernet Franc Rosé 2017
Chateau Leoube Le Secret de Leoube Rosé 2017
Château des Bertrands Réserve des Bertrands Élegance Rosé 2017
Château Roubine La Vie en Rose Rosé 2017
2.Description: The Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah for this wine were harvested at night to preserve freshness. Expect a vibrant, crisp wine with youthful red fruit flavours and a sharp, defined acidity. It will be great with chicken dishes, charcuterie or cheese platters.

2.Wine Name: Xavier Vignon Côtes du Rhône Rosé 2017

2.Description: Sourced from vines planted on clay-limestone, granitic and sandy soils, this is direct pressed. Beaujolais rosé is a real treat and this one, from iconic producer Georges Duboeuf, will be a great take on the style. Look for a wine with impressive floral and orange citrus tones. Enjoy with salmon.

2.By:: Podere Cervarola Di Andrea Della Ca

2.Wine Name: Delas Saint-Esprit Côtes du Rhône Rosé 2017
2.By:: Delas Vins A St Jean De Muzols
2.Description: This winery was founded 160 years ago and is owned by the Lallier-Deutz family, the same owners of Champagne Deutz. A blend based on Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, this pink wine shows raspberry, pear and pomegranate. The producer suggests pairings of cold cuts or sausages.

2.Wine Name: Château Val Joanis Cuvée Joséphine Rosé 2017
Agricola Cirelli Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo DOC Anfora 2017

2.By:: Val Di Toro Di Anna Maria Cruciata
Val Di Toro Di Anna Maria Cruciata

2.Wine Name: Ferdinando Spumante Extra Brut Rosé Belén

2.By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

2.Wine Name: Tenuta del Buonamico Dea Rosa IGT Rosato 2017
Tenuta del Buonamico Dea Rosa IGT Rosato 2017

2.By:: Az. Agr. Demarie Giovanni Di D

2.Wine Name: Bois Garde Vin Pays de Mediter Rosé
Di Berardino Rose D'Abruzzo DOC Rosa Sera 2017
La Coste Premiere Cuvee Rose? d'une Nuit AOP Coteaux d'Aix 2017
La Coste Cha?teau Rose? AOP Coteaux d'Aix en Provence 2017
La Coste Grand Vin Rose AOP Coteaux d'Aix en Provence 2017
Garreliere Le Rosé de la Cabane 2017
Domaine Marie Thibault La Roue Qui Tourne Petnat Rosé 2017

2.By:: Vitis Divine Limited Operating As D

2.Wine Name: Pères De L'Église Caprice Rosé Vin De France 2016
Barafakas Rosé Semi Sweet Three Witches 2017
By Chadsey's Cairns Roxey Rosé VQA

2.Description: Typically crafted in a bright, sophisticated style that puts vibrancy and fruit at the forefront. You can expect to find a floral, crisp, fresh wine with tangy red fruit and zesty citrus tones. A versatile blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez that is ideal for alfresco dining and will be superb, chilled, with grilled salmon.

This is crafted to evoke comparison with the rosé wines of Provence, France. You can expect aromas and flavours of watermelon, red peppery jelly, red apple, strawberry, garden herbs and maraschino cherry. This will be a great sipper, or pair with seafood appetizers.

2.Wine Name: Belle Glos Oeil de Perdrix Pinot Noir Blanc Rosé 2017
2.Description: The Pinot Noir for this wine was grown with the specific intent of making this rosé. (Sometimes a rosé is crafted from runoff juice from grapes destined to make red wine.) In France, this style of wine is traditionally known as oeil-de-perdrix, which translates to 'eye of the partridge' and refers to its pale pink colour. A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this wine goes toward breast cancer research.

To craft this wine, the ever-experimental Susana Balbo had the Malbec and Pinot Noir picked early and used extremely gentle pressing to get the colour she wanted. You will find a crisp, fresh wine with bright red berry tones and a refined minerality. This will be amazing with smoked salmon.

This blend featuring the red grape Grenache and white grape Viura (Macabeo) is typically crafted to be dry, vibrant, fresh and crisp, with good structure and presence. Noted for its delicately articulated, lifted floral notes with fully invested strawberry and raspberry tones. An excellent warm-weather sipper, this will be a fine match for grilled seafood or grilled chicken.

2.Wine Name: Rose Delle Venezie IGT 11 Minutes Pasqua 2016
Chateau Saint Martin No 2 AOP Provence Rose 2016
Figuiere Var Le St Andre IGP Rose 2016
Vino Lauria Rose Zio Paolo Sicilane 2016

2.By:: G. Tsimpidis And Co. Monemvasia Win

2.Wine Name: Luigi Bosca a Rosé is a Rosé is a Rosé 2017
Huff Estates South Bay Vineyards Rosé

2.Description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Cabernet Franc sourced from the rich clay loam and shale of the Vinemount Ridge. This will be a nimble, food-friendly wine. Look for characteristic strawberry and raspberry, with a savoury note tugging at the edges. You will find this a fine sipping wine, but the freshness allows it great flexibility with food - give it a go with everything from burgers or grilled pork ribs to fruit salads.

This rosé from Conundrum marks new territory for this well-known brand. Crafted from Valdiguié (val-deeg-yay), which is now rare in its native France and is mostly found in California (though still in very small amounts). You can expect this to be a bright, fruity expression with suggestions of strawberries and watermelon. A real conversation-starter, this unique wine will have you puzzling over why Conundrum didn't get into the rosé game before!

2.Wine Name: Château de Berne Terres de Berne Rosé 2017
Chivite Las Fincas Vino de la Tierra Rosado 2017
2.Description: The IGP Vino de la Tierra 3 Riberas designation was established in 2008. It takes its name from the flood plains of the Arga, Ega and Aragón rivers. This rosé is crafted from Garnacha and Tempranillo and will be an elegant, fresh, fruity wine that will have the lift and freshness for a wide range of foods.

2.Wine Name: Hecht & Bannier Côtes de Provence Rosé 2017

2.Description: This domaine, originally a truffle orchard, was converted to a vineyard in the early 1900s.

'Ostal' means both ''house'' and ''family group'' in the ancient Occitan language. Expect a fond welcome as this elegantly easygoing pink blend of half-Syrah, half-Grenache offers inviting aromas and flavours of nectarine, clementine and pomegranate. Pair with canapés, scallops or garlic shrimp.

2.Wine Name: Domaines Ott Château de Selle Rosé 2017
2.Description: Founded in 1912, Domaines Ott is responsible for crafting some of the most renowned and serious rosés in the world. These wines are characteristically intense and complex with layers of fruit and smoky mineral. They are distinctively balanced and structured. Today, operations at Domaines Ott are overseen by Louis Roederer.

2.Wine Name: Château de Léoube La Londe Rosé 2017

2.Description: The first traces of the château's site date back to Gaullist times during which its location served as a lookout point to spot intruders coming by boat into the Gulf of Frejus. Thankfully, the only forces likely to be bearing down on your place when this rosé is on hand are your wine-loving friends looking to share a glass. The blend consists primarily of Grenache and Rolle (Vermentino). The 2015 Vintage was awarded a rating of 90 points by James Molesworth, who described it as '[Showing] lovely range and tension for a rosé' (winespectator.com, Aug. 31, 2016).

2.Wine Name: Château de l'Aumerade Cuvée Marie-Christine Rosé
2.By:: Sa Fabre-Ch. De L'Aumerade Cru Cl

2.Description: Anew Wines (though it doesn't say it on the eye-catching label) is part of the Washington icon Chateau Ste. Michelle Wine Estates' umbrella. This dry rosé is an unconventional blend of Syrah and Sangiovese that delivers notes of apricot, orange zest and white tea. Sip with summer salads or grilled shrimp.

2.By:: Sa Fabre-Ch. De L'Aumerade Cru Cl

2.Description: The Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah used here are sourced from plots across the centrally located villages of Gonfaron, Flassans sur Issole and Pignans, and also from the village of Puyloubier, situated at the foot of Montagne Sainte Victoire. You can expect a classically styled, fresh and balanced wine with impressive red berry tones and excellent food-friendly acidity. Enjoy with grilled pork, chicken or salmon, or with summer salads.
Light salmon pink; slightly sweet, light, soft & fruity with hints of berry & peach; a true crowd pleaser.
Available at select VINTAGES locations.
Available at select VINTAGES locations.

Tawse produces this wine in the saignée method, which uses free-run juice from select red grapes, in this case harvested from single-vineyard sites. You can expect a vibrant, dynamic wine with impressive red fruit, watermelon and floral notes. Pair with chicken fajitas, charcuterie, mild and soft cheeses, or Thai noodle salad.

This superbly popular wine is always eagerly anticipated by Vintages customers. A reliably bright, fresh wine that will deliver suggestions of red cherry and raspberry with zesty citrus and a tantalizing hint of spice on the end. A fun summer wine with the versatility to play well with grilled salmon steaks or a summer salad.

2.Wine Name: Mas des Bressades Cuvée Tradition Rosé 2017
2.Description: Rosés from Costières de Nîmes must comprise a minimum of 60% Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre, with Carignan and Cinsault in support. This one is a perennial customer favourite, beloved for its charm and depth of expression. From one of the most reliable names in the Southern Rhône, it will offer vibrant, juicy, sunny fruit with savoury herb and garrigue tones. Perfect for grilled seafood, this will delight, plain and simple.

2.Wine Name: Château la Tour de l'Évêque Rosé 2017
2.Description: The vines from which this perennially popular rosé is sourced are organically farmed and harvested by hand. The 2017 vintage blends 45% Grenache, 28% Cinsault and 11% Syrah with splashes of Sémillon, Rolle, Mourvèdre, Ugni Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Expect a zesty, berry-and-citrus-fruity rosé that will be ideal with summer salads, grilled seafood or smoked salmon.

2.Wine Name: Peninsula Ridge Beal Vineyard Cabernet Rosé 2017
Château des Charmes Cuvée d'Andrée Rosé 2016

2.Description: This blend of Garnacha, Viura and Tempranillo is a classic, and a long-time favourite on Vintages shelves. Look for this rosé from Muga to offer impressive tangy red berry, citrus, peach and rosewater tones. This is always a lively, fresh wine that has amazing versatility with food. Try it with seafood, salads, grilled chicken or even burgers.
This domaine, originally a truffle orchard, was converted to a vineyard in the early 1900s.

2.Wine Name: Domaine Maby La Forcadière Tavel Rosé 2017

2.Description: Villa Maria was founded in 1961 by Sir George Fistonich. (He was just plain old George then, before all the accolades came rolling in - among them the distinction of being the first person to receive a knighthood for services to the wine industry.) In March 2018, Fistonich stepped down as CEO after 57 years, but he remains active as president and brand ambassador. This will be a crisp, characterful rosé with cherry, citrus and grass tones. Chill and sip or serve with a charcuterie platter.

2.Wine Name: Hacienda Lopez de Haro Old Vines Rosado 2017
Fattoria Sardi Le Cicale Rose IGT Toscana 2016
Château de Nages Vieilles Vignes Rosé 2017

2.Description: Perennially popular (despite the grapes being given the 'pink slip' before they could join their colleagues in other wines), this pink wine is brimming with ripe strawberry, raspberry and red cherry with a pretty floral embroidery and a tangy finish. Enjoy it with grilled fish or seafood, summer salads, turkey sandwiches, or mild cheeses such as brie.

2.Wine Name: Gérard Bertrand Côte des Roses Rosé 2017
2.Description: A classically styled blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah that always delivers a vibrant, complex array of citrus, red fruit and herbal tones. Consistency is as much its stock-in-trade as is the eye-catching rose-shaped bottle. Equally at home at a backyard barbecue with grilled chicken or as a component of a more refined dining experience that calls for a bright, elegant touch at table.

2.Wine Name: Enclos Des Anges Rosé AOP Corse Calvi 2016
Modestine AOP Cotes Du Rhone Rose 2015
2.By:: Scea Domaine De La Sabatiere - Cote
Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

2.Description: Year in and year out, this is a reliably juicy, fresh wine that makes a real splash with its bright ripe red cherry, rhubarb and strawberry notes. Perfect with barbecue fare - think grilled stuffed peppers or barbecued shrimp.

2.Wine Name: Pelee Island Lola Cabernet Franc Rosé 2017

2.Description: Crafted from old-vine Garnacha, this Spanish rosé is produced in a style that emulates the rosés of Provence. It comes in a sexy package as well, which makes it a pretty as well as tasty gift for your hosts. You will encounter a lifted floral note atop strawberry, delicate spice and herbs. This will have the acidity to pair with just about anything you would like to try it with, so experiment with everything from salads to seafood to barbecued ribs.

The previous two vintages of this popular Grenache-based rosé from the team behind Cannonball wines scored 90 points from major reviewers, so expect big things from this latest vintage. Pour it with grilled chicken wings or burgers for heavenly (and thematically appropriate) pairings, pardner.

2.Wine Name: Jean-Max Roger La Grange Dîmière Sancerre Rosé 2017
2.Description: Crafted from vines between 10 and 40 years of age, this Pinot Noir rosé will be an energetic wine that offers a complex collection of red fruit with touches of Sancerre's beloved minerality. This is a rosé that can age, so enjoy it tonight with smoked salmon or explore its development over the next three years.

Our panel was so impressed by the 2016 vintage of this wine, which Jancis Robinson, MW, called a 'really serious rosé' (jancisrobinson.com, Aug. 25, 2017), that we brought in the newly released 2017 vintage just in time for summer. Expect big peach, tangerine, savoury herb notes and plenty of structure and pair it with your favourite grilled lake fish.

This one is not to be missed; Beaujolais rosé is an uncommon sight EVERYWHERE, including in Beaujolais. Though production of this bright, refreshing style has increased in recent years, it's still exceptionally rare. Less rosé wine is made in Beaujolais than white wine (and they make very little white wine), but their rosés are more than mere curiosities. Expect lifted red fruit, a touch of pepper spice and a tangy, refreshing acidity from this wine, which is crafted from Gamay. An ideal sipper to accompany a casual backyard lunch.

This is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro, which is no surprise, as these two are the most important varieties in Dão's red blends. When used to craft rosé, they produce intense red cherry, strawberry and raspberry tones with a bright, juicy food-friendly acidity. This will be an ideal barbecue wine capable of pairing with grilled chicken, pork, ribs or salmon, as well as summer salads.
40% Grenache, 40% Cinsault, 10% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre.

This Grenache-based pink wine is matured on the fine lees for several weeks before bottling. Look for notions of peach, yellow plum, fresh wild herbs and citrus peel and pour with grilled shellfish or Thai curries.

This Grenache-based pink wine is matured on the fine lees for several weeks before bottling. Look for notions of peach, yellow plum, fresh wild herbs and citrus peel and pour with grilled shellfish or Thai curries.

2.Wine Name: G. Marquis The Silver Line Pink Pinot 2017

2.Description: A great value, this will be a fun, vibrant wine offering peach, apricot and nectarine flavours with the area's characteristic underlying herbal notes. Sip it on its own or pair with herbed chicken breast or grilled sausages.

This wine is from one of the best-known families in all of France and one of the great havens for rosé. Tavel's rosés are notably colourful and flavourful, and you can expect this to provide a wealth of complex, layered red raspberry and citrus with a refined herbal underbelly that really locks in the provenance. Perfect for grilled salmon or pork.

2.Wine Name: Domaines Ott Château de Selle Rosé 2017
2.Description: Founded in 1912, Domaines Ott is responsible for crafting some of the most renowned and serious rosés in the world. These wines are characteristically intense and complex with layers of fruit and smoky mineral. They are distinctively balanced and structured. Today, operations at Domaines Ott are overseen by Louis Roederer.

2.Wine Name: La Cadiérenne Cuvée Grande Tradition Bandol Rosé 2017
2.Description: This is crafted from Mourvèdre, Grenache and Cinsault. Bandol rosés are tremendously popular, and this is always a classic example of this complex style. Expect the region's telltale spice, herb and earth tones to be artfully interwoven with suggestions of strawberry, peach, citrus and mineral. This will prove a superb option for grilled seafood such as salmon and will also shine alongside smoked ham.

2.Wine Name: San Marzano Tramari Rosé di Primitivo 2017

2.Description: Rosé wines are, among other things, very food-friendly. This one is a blend of Syrah, Grenache, Cinsault and Mourvèdre and is typically crafted in a lighter style that puts the spotlight on the brightness of the red fruit and floral tones. You can expect this to be a well-made, balanced wine that will work well as an aperitif, but don't be afraid to pair it with barbecued fare such as fish, chicken or ribs.

This is crafted using the appassimento process: a specialty of the iconic Masi that employs partially dried grapes to impart even greater concentration and flavour to the final wine. Expect this rosé to be bright and lively with tangy red fruit and a lifted floral tone. The appassimento process will also make its presence known through a distinctive smoothness and textured mouthfeel. Enjoy with grilled chicken, pork ribs or seafood.

2.Wine Name: Gérard Bertrand Côte des Roses Rosé 2017

2.Description: A blend of Grenache Noir, Cinsault and Syrah grown in south-facing vineyards. The grapes are harvested at night to ensure they are as cool as possible - a technique that helps preserve the freshness and vibrancy that makes this rosé so desirable and food-friendly. Look for ripe, bright raspberry, cherry and strawberry and a marked, fine mineral undertone. Sourced from sunny climes, this wine is totally at home outside at a barbecue.

2.Wine Name: Königschaffhauser Vulkanfelsen Trocken Pinot Noir Rosé 2017
2.Description: Grown in the winery's estate vineyards on the outskirts of the village of Königschaffhausen (imagine writing that every time you give your address), this 100% Pinot Noir rosé consistently shows lovely pink grapefruit, red plum and herb notes with juicy, bright acidity and a lip-smacking finish. Pair with grilled sausages or schnitzel.

Mostly Pinot Noir, this rosé is crafted from grapes sourced from Monterey, Sonoma and Santa Barbara counties. The aim is to take the best of each region: the vibrant acidity and minerality of Monterey, the ripe red fruit and intensity of Sonoma, and the balance and texture of Santa Barbara. Expect ripe strawberry, watermelon and orange citrus tones. This refreshing wine will have superb versatility at the table; try it with pork ribs, salmon or grilled chicken.

2.Wine Name: Ashley Mary Limited Edition M de Minuty Rosé 2017
2.Description: Crafted from Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, this wine was produced using the direct-pressing method. One distinction of direct pressing is that the grapes are grown specifically to produce rosé rather than being an offshoot of red wine production. This method is preferred in Provence, and results in the characteristic light colour of the wines. You can expect this one to deliver fresh fruit, orange citrus and mineral tones. Serve with seafood, shellfish or chicken dishes.

2.Wine Name: Rocca Di Montemassi Syrosa Maremma Toscana DOC 2017

2.By:: Sociedade Da Casa Agricola Da Quint

2.Description: This is made from 100% Espadeiro: a traditional grape variety native to the Vinho Verde region. Expect this to be a spicy little number with impressive citrus and herbal tones. This is a vegan-friendly wine.

2.By:: Val Di Toro Di Anna Maria Cruciata

3.Description: Possibly the greatest value for non-vintage Champagne on the planet, this is a simply stunning fizz featuring aromas of pear, smoke, spice, herbs and dried flowers. Perfect with grilled salmon, stuffed pork tenderloin or even popcorn (seriously!).

The #1-selling rosé Champagne in the world, this refreshing bubbly made from Pinot Noir grapes displays aromas of raspberry, redcurrant, flint, sour cherry and citrus. Made for fine dining, it will delight with rack of lamb with rosemary and garlic.

3.Wine Name: Armand de Brignac Ace of Spades Brut Gold Champagne
Moët & Chandon Grand Vintage Extra Brut Rosé Champagne 2009
Domaine Jeeper Extra Brut Cuvee Naturelle
Moët & Chandon Grand Vintage Extra Brut Champagne 2009
Soutiran Brut Blanc de Blanc Grand Cru
Sarl Champagne William Saintot Cuvee Seduction Champagne
Lallier Grand Cru Brut Rosé Champagne
Champagne Gosset Petite Douceur Rosé Extra Dry
Champagne Gosset Celebris Rosé Extra Brut 2007

3.Description: Crafted by one of the oldest Champagne houses, and only in exceptional years, this cuvée is a gift fit for royalty. In fact, 14 royal courts have enjoyed its impeccable quality. Awarded 97 points by Wine Spectator.

3.Wine Name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin Vintage Brut Rosé Champagne 2008
Champagne Eric Rodez Cuvee Des Crayeres
Champagne Eric Rodez Blanc de Blancs

3.Description: This bubbly is made in a consistent style year after year. Expect similar character and quality even if the lot number differs from the bottle reviewed.

3.Wine Name: Vollereaux Blanc de Blancs Brut Champagne
Nicolas Feuillatte Blanc de Noirs Brut Grand Cru Champagne 2004
Vincent Carré Réserve Brut 1er Cru Champagne
Bollinger La Grande Année Brut Rosé Champagne 2007
3.Description: Grande Année is only produced in exceptional vintages. The blend consists of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay harvested strictly from grand and premier cru vineyards. The initial fermentation occurs in oak casks, and the wine is then aged in the Bollinger cellars on its lees for a minimum of five years before disgorgement. This recently released 2007 vintage has not yet been reviewed; expect the vibrancy, complexity and floral notes for which this wine is prized.

3.Wine Name: Champagne Leclerc Briant Brut Rose Organic
Champagne Jeeper Brut Cuvee Grande Reserve Blanc De Blancs
Champagne Leclerc Briant Les Chevres 1er cru
Larmandier-Bernier Longitude Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut 1er Cru Champagne
Soutiran Brut Blanc de Noir Grand Cru Perle Noir
Taittinger Comtes de Champagne Brut Rosé 2006
Henriet-Bazin Sélection de Parcelles 1er Cru Brut Champagne
Barons de Rothschild Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Laurent-Perrier Grand Siècle Grande Cuvée Champagne
Gaston Chiquet Grand Cru d'Aÿ Blanc de Blancs Brut Champagne
Louis De Sacy Grand Cru Brut Rosé Champagne
Ruinart Blanc de Blancs Brut Champagne
Tarlant L'Aérienne Prestige Millésime Brut Champagne 2004
Moutard Père & Fils Grande Cuvée Brut Champagne
Pol Roger Brut Blanc de Blancs Extra Cuvée de Réserve Champagne 2009
Paul Bara Réserve Brut Grand Cru Champagne

3.Description: Gold Medal winner at the 2013 World Wine Championships.

3.Wine Name: Tarlant Cuvée Louis Brut Nature Champagne
Gosset 15 Ans de Cave a Minima Brut Champagne
Armand de Brignac Brut Rosé Champagne
Le Mesnil Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Champagne 2009
Armand de Brignac Ace of Spades Gold Brut Champagne
Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin Brut Vintage Champagne
3.Description: An iconoclast like Veuve Clicquot herself, this rich and racy bubbly has notes of date, apple, poached pear, hay bale and bread dough. A great food Champagne deserving of a fine meal like king crab legs or lobster-stuffed ravioli.

3.Wine Name: Krug Grande Cuvée Brut Champagne 166ème Édition
Veuve Clicquot La Grande Dame Brut Champagne 2006

3.Description: Once occupied by Cistercian monks from Clairvaux Abbey, this Champagne house includes some magnificent 12th-century vaulted cellars. Drappier was founded in 1808 and, in the 1930s, became the first producer in the village of Urville to plant Pinot Noir - a decision that was mocked at the time, although history has shown that the variety positively thrives there. This bubbly is made from 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay.

3.Wine Name: Champagne Leclerc Briant Brut Reserve Organic
Champagne Leclerc Briant Les Crayeres 1er cru
Charles Mignon Premium Réserve Brut Champagne
3.Description: This non-vintage bubbly is made in a consistent style and will show similar quality and character even if the lot number differs from that cited in the review.

3.Wine Name: Gardet Cuvée Saint Flavy Tradition Brut Champagne
Billecart Salmon Blanc De Blancs Champagne
Billecart Salmon Brut Blanc De Blancs Champagne
Champagne Gosset Grand Blanc De Blancs Brut
Champagne Gosset 15 Ans De Cave Minima Brut
Taittinger Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Champagne 2006
Barons de Rothschild Brut Rosé Champagne
Dom Pérignon Vintage Brut Rosé Champagne 2005
Château de Bligny Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Moutard Père & Fils Rosé de Cuvaison Brut Champagne
Collet Blanc de Blancs Brut Champagne
Louis Roederer et Philippe Starck Brut Nature Champagne 2009
Taittinger Brut Reserve FIFA World Cup 2018 Limited Edition
Vilmart & Cie Grand Cellier 1er Cru Brut Champagne
Bollinger La Grande Année Brut Champagne 2007
Armand de Brignac Blanc de Blancs Champagne
Ruinart R de Ruinart Brut Champagne

4.Wine Name: Bottega Petalo Il Vino Dell'Amore Moscato
Santa Margherita Brut Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore
Bottega Vino Dei Poeti Prosecco DOC

4.Description: Since creating their first in 1998, 13th Street's sparkling wines have been one of their great strengths. Dry with a bright acidity and a creamy mousse, the Brut Rosé offers red fruit and mineral tones. Perfect as an aperitif or with smoked salmon.

4.Wine Name: Henry Of Pelham Cuvée Catharine Rosé Brut VQA
4.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

4.Wine Name: Chateau de Montgueret Cremant de Loire Brut
Henry Of Pelham Cuvée Catharine Brut VQA
4.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

4.Wine Name: Jacob's Creek Chardonnay Pinot Noir Sparkling
Cave Spring Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling
De Chanceny Cremant De Loire Rose Brut

4.Description: Ontario's sparkling wines have been opening eyes, turning heads, making a splash - no matter how you choose to track it, their trajectory has been impressive. This is from Chardonnay and Pinot and will deliver great balance and freshness with apple, pear and peach tones with underlying fresh bread notes. Perfect for anything from seafood appetizers to popcorn.

4.Wine Name: Paul Delane Cremant De Bourgogne Reserve
Jackson-Triggs Méthode Cuve Close Sparkling VQA
Bottega Vino Dei Poeti Brut Rose
Henry of Pelham Cuvée Catharine Carte Blanche Estate Blanc de Blanc 2013
4.By:: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery
4.Description: Gold Medal winner at the 2018 National Wine Awards of Canada.

4.Wine Name: Tawse Spark Limestone Ridge Sparkling Riesling
4.Description: From Tawse, one of the most exciting names in Ontario winemaking, this single-vineyard expression is a complex and intense wine that delivers amazing value. Elegant and appealing with touches lemon zest, honey, mineral and green apple. Enjoy with oysters or grilled seafood.

4.Wine Name: Villa Sandi Prosecco Il Fresco DOC, Treviso
Pierre Sparr Cremant D'Alsace Brut Reserve
Veuve Ambal Cremant De Bourgogne Grande Cuvee Brut
Bailly Lapierre Réserve Brut Crémant de Bourgogne
4.Description: Crafted from 100% Chardonnay, this is made in a fresh, zesty style with lemon, lime, apple and toast notes and underlying earthy and mineral tones. Always a great value option to Champagne.

4.Wine Name: Grande Cuvee 1531 De Aimery Cremant De Limoux

4.Description: This pink bubbly is made in the Charmat method (which winemaker Mauro Salvador calls 'metodo Italiano'), the same process behind Italian Prosecco sparkling wines.

4.Wine Name: Mionetto Prestige Prosecco Brut DOC Treviso

4.By:: Cultivos De Uvas Ecologicas Y Vinos
Azienda Vinicola I Tre Mori Sas

4.Description: Ontario's prowess with sparkling wines is no longer much of a secret: far too many superb examples have been made to keep a lid on the news. This traditional-method sparkler from Jackson-Triggs has always waved the flag with particular poise. You can expect a refined wine with apple, pear, lemon citrus and baked bread tones. A luxury sparkler at an affordable price, this would be a sophisticated palate-refresher at a formal meal.

Crafted from Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Riesling and Aligoté, which are all grapes long associated with sparkling wine production. This was aged for three years in bottle before release. You can expect brightly outlined orchard fruit and a zesty, driving acidity that will balance the wine's sweetness. Enjoy with spicy crab appetizers.

4.By:: Caves Do Solar De Sao Domingos
Caves Do Solar De Sao Domingos

4.Wine Name: Sexy Sparkling Gold Brut Blanc De Blanc

4.Description: So varied are the conditions and terroir in the Curicó Valley that Echeverría works with plots of only half an acre to maximize the nuance and potential of each mesoclimate. This is crafted from Chardonnay and Pinot with an eye to emphasizing elegance and freshness. You can expect lively suggestions of apple, pear and apricot along with the traditional method's characteristic baked bread tones.

4.Wine Name: Rosehall Run Ceremony Brut Blanc de Blancs

4.Description: Founded in 1890 by a Piedmont native, Pascual Toso is one of Argentina's oldest producers, but that doesn't mean they aren't forward-thinking. Internationally acclaimed consultant winemaker Paul Hobbs has worked with Pascual Toso for nearly 20 years. This sparkler is crafted from 100% Chardonnay sourced from an altitude of 750 metres and is made in an easy-to-enjoy style that aims to deliver balanced lime citrus and bready autolytic notes. Enjoy as a sipper or with grilled seafood appetizers.

4.Wine Name: Foss Marai Roös Brut Spumante Rosé
San Gregorio Prosecco Valdobbiadene Frizzante DOCG
4.By:: San Gregorio Az Agricola Soc Agrico

4.Wine Name: Cantin Arte Gaia Cerasuolo Prosecco DOC 2017

4.Description: Named Best Sparkling Wine, Non-Vintage Brut at the 2018 Winemaker Challenge International Wine Competition.

4.Wine Name: JCB N° 21 Brut Crémant de Bourgogne
4.Description: You can expect this Crémant from Jean-Charles Boisset to be a crisp, richly textured wine with impressive citrus and bright fruit tones. There will be a driving acidity here, keeping the wine lithe and fresh and asserting the style's food-friendly character. Great with seafood, fish, grilled pork or as a palate-refresher between bites for any meal.

4.Wine Name: Boisset JCB No. 69 Brut Rosé Crémant de Bourgogne
NV-Bonnet Huteau Nuit Boreale Method Traditionale
Bott Geyl Cremant d'Alsace Brut Cuvee Paul Edouard

4.By:: Podere Cervarola Di Andrea Della Ca

4.Description: Gold Medal winner at both the 2018 National Wine Awards of Canada and the 2018 All Canadian Wine Championships.

4.Wine Name: P Morena V.Spumante R Millesim Dry 2015
Lily Sparkling with Ice Bucket New Year's Offer
Alma Mater Semi Sweet 71 White Frizzante
Nino Franco Brut Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore
Ca' del Bosco Cuvée Prestige Brut Franciacorta

4.By:: Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.
Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.

4.Wine Name: Marcel Cabelier Extra Brut Vintage 60 Mois
4.By:: Les Grands Chais De France S.A

4.Wine Name: Huff Estates Cuvée Peter F. Huff 2015
Tenuta del Buonamico Particolare Spumante Rose Brut
Tenuta del Buonamico Particolare Spumante Dolce
Marfil Escumos Blanc de Noir Brut 2015
Voga Sparkling Rose Of Pinot Grigio

4.By:: Az. Agr. Demarie Giovanni Di D

4.Wine Name: La Coste La bulle de la Coste Rosé Vin Mousseux
Clos Lentiscus Rosé Brut Nature Penedes DO 2012
Rolet Creman Jura Brut Coeur Chardonnay 2014
San Giuseppe Prosseco Superiore DOCG Extra Dry 2017
Real Imperial Brut Seleccion Cava Kosher
G. Marquis Silver Line Blanc de Noirs Ice Rosé Sparkling
Jackson-Triggs Entourage Grand Reserve Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc 2015

4.Description: Available at select VINTAGES locations.

Made with the Gamay grape, this wine is named for the pink-hued aurora borealis witnessed by founders Jonas Newman and Vicki Samaras while picking grapes in an Ontario vineyard one magical evening. Look for fresh berry character with notions of brioche and spicy white pepper.
Although this will be a different bottling than that tasted in Sara d'Amato's review, you can expect a similar quality and flavour profile.

4.Wine Name: 2027 Cellars Queenston Road Vineyard Blanc De Blancs 2013
Peller Estates Ice Cuvée Rosé Sparkling
Segura Viudas Heredad Reserva Brut Cava
Dom Pérignon Oenothèque Brut Rosé Champagne 1988
4.Description: The Oenothèque label indicates that a Dom Pérignon vintage has reached either its second peak in maturity, with optimized intensity (15 to 20 years after harvest), or its third peak, with optimized complexity (after 30 years on the lees). Kept undisturbed in their original bottles in the Dom Pérignon cellars, these wines offer a rare opportunity to experience mature Champagnes aged in perfect conditions.  Decanter, in their Vintage Guide, awards 1988 a perfect five-star rating in their Vintage Guide, remarking: 'Classically structured, concentrated wines with sufficient acidity for long ageing.'

4.Wine Name: Dom Pérignon Oenothèque Brut Rosé Champagne 1982
4.Description: The Oenothèque label indicates that a Dom Pérignon vintage has reached either its second peak in maturity, with optimized intensity (15 to 20 years after harvest), or its third peak, with optimized complexity (after 30 years on the lees). Kept undisturbed in their original bottles in the Dom Pérignon cellars, these wines offer a rare opportunity to experience mature Champagnes aged in perfect conditions.  Decanter, in their Vintage Guide, awards 1982 a perfect five-star rating in their Vintage Guide, remarking: 'An exceptionally fine, rich vintage.'

4.Wine Name: Bailly-Lapierre Chardonnay Brut Crémant de Bourgogne
Nino Franco Grave di Stecca Brut Prosecco 2012

4.By:: Casal Do Paco Padreiro, Sociedade V
Casal Do Paco Padreiro, Sociedade V

4.Wine Name: Patrick Chan Sparkling Blanc de Blancs 2011
Domaine Bousquet Organic Pinot Noir/Chardonnay Brut Rosé Sparkling

4.Description: Crafted using the Charmat method (often used to create Prosecco), which sees the second fermentation take place within a tank rather than the individual bottle. This process is particularly useful when crafting sparkling wines using aromatic varieties, as it helps preserve the more delicate aroma and flavour notes. This sparkler is made using Vidal and Pinot Grigio. 'Momenti' is Italian for 'moments,' a great handle for a sparkling wine that will make any moment that little bit extra special. You will find this to be a floral, fruity sparkler with fresh apple and tropical fruit tones and that refreshing, vibrant acidity that is a characteristic of Ontario.

4.Wine Name: Marie-Pierre Manciat Brut Crémant de Bourgogne

4.Description: This will be a floral, fun, fruity sparkler. Look for a stylish, pleasing wine that delivers notes of lifted red berries and savoury herbs in a fresh, energetic package. Enjoy as a sipper or with lightly spiced seafood appetizers.

4.By:: Caves Sao Joao - Sociedade Dos Vinh

4.Wine Name: Zardetto Molín Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore 2015
Vinha Maria Bruto Sparkling White Wine
Château Moncontour Cuvée Prédilection Brut Vouvray 2015

4.By:: Casal Do Paco Padreiro, Sociedade V

4.Wine Name: Louis Bouillot Perle d'Or Brut Crémant de Bourgogne 2009
4.Description: A blend of 50% Pinot Noir and 50% Chardonnay.

4.Wine Name: De Grenelle Saumur Blanc Grande Cuvée Sparkling
4.Description: Awarded 2 out of 3 Stars in the 2014 Guide Hachette des Vins.

4.Wine Name: Krone Borealis Vintage Cuvée Brut Sparkling 2016
4.Description: '90% Chardonnay, 9% Pinot Noir, 1% Pinot Blanc ... Elegant, iridescent gold in colour; Oyster shell and chalky limestone character leads to pineapple, fresh yellow apple and salted caramel flavours with a fine, persistent mouth-filling mousse; Creamy textures on the mid-palate with some baked pie-crust, and a refreshing, tangy finish.' (weekendspecial.co.za, Oct. 25, 2017)

4.Wine Name: Cave de Lugny Crémant de Bourgogne Brut Blanc de Blancs
Hush Heath Leslie's Reserve NV Sparkling
Masi Bossi Fedrigotti Conte Federico Riserva Brut 2012
4.Description: This sparkling wine was awarded 3 glasses in Gambero Rosso Italian Wines 2018, which referred to it as 'offering up a lovely aromatic complexity recalling dried fruit and baked cookie spices. In the mouth, its body proved creamy, with a somewhat citrusy acidity, that draws back in the finish, leaving room for pleasant length.'

4.Wine Name: Château des Charmes Blanc de Blancs Sparkling Wine 2014

4.By:: Societe Viticole Du Domaine De La P

4.Wine Name: Hush Heath Balfour 1503 Classic Cuvée Brut Sparkling
Domaine J. Laurens Le Moulin Brut Blanquette de Limoux
Dufouleur Père & Fils Brut Crémant de Bourgogne
Bon Courage Jacques Bruére Cuvée Rosé Brut

4.Description: Crafted in the traditional method that sees the second fermentation take place in the bottle, this 100% Chenin Blanc is a fine alternative to Champagne. This will have an excellent minerality and a crisp, vibrant and tangy character.

4.Wine Name: Wolf Blass Gold Label Chardonnay Pinot Noir Sparkling
Konzelmann Rose Methode Cuve Close VQA
Villa Sandi Prosecco DOC (See NEW LCBO# 394387)
Chartron et Trébuchet Crémant de Bourgogne

4.Description: Available at select VINTAGES locations.

4.Wine Name: Angels Gate Archangel Sparkling Chardonnay VQA
Cono Sur Sparkling Pinot Noir Rosé
Louis Bouillot Perle d'Ivoire Brut Blanc de Blancs Crémant de Bourgogne
Villa Maria Lightly Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc
Rosehall Run Pixie Sparkling Rosé VQA

4.Description: Available at select VINTAGES locations.

4.Wine Name: Domaine Des Nugues Made By G

4.Description: Vieni is an Ontario producer with an Italian sensibility. This sparkling wine was made using the Charmat method, the same process used to craft Prosecco. Here, the result is a crisp, gently floral fizz with plenty of tangy apple character. Pair with cheese or veggie appetizers.

4.Wine Name: Vineland Estates Sparkling Pinot Meunier Reserve 2015
Krone Cuvée Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé Sparkling 2017
4.Description: 'Méthode Cap Classique' is South African shorthand for the very same time-tested traditional method used to make Champagne. An incredible value, this pink example blends 85% Pinot Noir and 15% Chardonnay sourced from a 300-year-old farm. Look for tangy red berry and citrus notes, and sip with crispy duck breast or your favourite early-autumn appetizers.
Ranked #25 on Wine Spectator's Top 100 of 2017, with a score of 92 points.

4.Wine Name: Château des Charmes Blanc de Blancs 2014
4.Description: Crafted from the classic pairing of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this is made using the traditional method, in which the second fermentation takes place in the individual bottle. This will have a creamy mouthfeel with complex, layered toast and vanilla custard elegantly integrated with the floral and fruity tones. Expect it to be sophisticated and long, with superb depth and character.
This wine received 92 points from tastings.com in April 2016.

This sparkling red is crafted from Cabernet, Merlot and Saperavi. It will offer a wealth of dark fruit and red berry tones in a refined, floral package. A firm, driving acidity will offer balance to the sweetness. This will make a unique and exotic addition to your meal. Serve with ice cream or other desserts.
Gold Medal winner at the 2018 National Wine Awards of Canada.

4.Wine Name: Louis Bouillot Perle d'Aurore Brut Rosé Crémant de Bourgogne
4.Description: Founded in 1877, Bouillot was one of the first to experiment with the crafting of sparkling Burgundy wine. This blend of Pinot Noir, Gamay and Chardonnay is ever delightful, fruity and dry with pretty strawberry, citrus and a touch of spice. Sip or pair with smoked salmon.

4.Wine Name: Pierre Sparr Brut Rosé Crémant d'Alsace
4.Description: A Gold Medal winner at the 2018 Palmares du Concours Général Agricole competition, this wine is made in a consistent style year after year.

4.Wine Name: Featherstone Joy Premium Cuvée Sparkling Rosé 2016
Gérard Bertrand Cuvée Thomas Jefferson Brut Crémant de Limoux 2016
4.Description: Some say Limoux is the area where sparkling wine originated when, in 1531, the monks of Saint Hilaire made the first wine with bubbles. Thomas Jefferson was reportedly Limoux's greatest admirer, and its fizzes were fixtures in his personal wine cellar. This wine offers exceptional value for bubbly made in the traditional method. Look for crisp orchard fruit and notions of honey on toast, and sip with battered fish and parsnip chips.
This wine received 92 points from tastings.com in April 2016.

4.Wine Name: Loosen Bros. Dr. L. Sparkling Riesling
Rechsteiner di Florian von Stepski-Doliwa Brut Prosecco
Vieni Zi Mari Red Sparkling Wine
Graham Beck Premier Cuvée Brut Blanc de Blancs 2013

4.Description: From the iconic Wagner family, this blend of Pinot Gris, Viognier, Muscat Canelli and Pinot Blanc (with just a kiss of Chardonnay) is sourced from cool coastal vineyards with abundant sunshine and Pacific fogs and breezes. This combination allows the grapes to ripen fully while holding on to the freshness and vibrancy that is so essential to the character of the final wine. You can expect this to have great versatility: equally capable as an aperitif or as a wine to enjoy and refresh throughout your meal.

4.Wine Name: Bailly Lapierre Réserve Brut Crémant de Bourgogne
4.Description: Crafted from 100% Chardonnay, this is made in a fresh, zesty style with lemon, lime, apple and toast notes and underlying earthy and mineral tones. Always a great value option to Champagne.

4.Wine Name: Bouvet Excellence Brut Crémant de Loire

4.Description: Awarded 92 points in Vinitaly's 5StarWines 2017.

'Canti Prosecco Ice contains 40 g/l of sugar - making it a demi-sec style of fizz - and the brand owner, Fratelli Martini, suggests pouring the Prosecco over five to seven ice cubes, depending on the size of glass.' (Patrick Schmitt, thedrinksbusiness.com, June 29, 2017)

4.Wine Name: Graham Beck Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé
Henri de Villamont Blanc de Blancs Crémant de Bourgogne
MAN Family Wines Méthode Cap Classique Brut
Joseph Cattin Brut Rosé Crémant d'Alsace
Domaine Chandon Blanc de Noirs Sparkling Wine
Gualberto Ricci Curbastro Franciacorta Extra Brut 2013
Gualberto Ricci Curbastro Franciacorta Saten Brut 2013

4.Description: Santa Margherita is well-known to Vintages customers (hello Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio 106450, we're looking at you!), and this sparkling rosé is a welcome addition to the family. Crafted from 50% Chardonnay, 45% Glera (Prosecco) and 5% Malbec. Expect a refreshing, food-friendly expression that will work well with seafood, pork, chicken or veggie dishes.

4.Wine Name: Louis Eschenauer Brut Crémant de Bordeaux
Boisset JCB French Kiss Sparkling Gamay
4.Description: Thought to be the very first technique for producing sparkling wines, the ancestral method involves a primary fermentation that is stopped before completion and a secondary fermentation that occurs in the bottle. This wine, made from Gamay, shows juicy berry fruit, earthy notes and lively bubbles.

4.Wine Name: Lebovitz Torre Vino Frizzante Rosso Secco Lambrusco Mantovano 2016
La Croix Montjoie Cremant De Bourgogne
Belcanto di Bellussi Extra Dry Prosecco di Valdobbiadene Superiore
Masi Canevel Extra Dry Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore 2017
Bartenura Sparkling Moscato Rosé KP M
Santero 958 Day Of The Dead Sparkling
Freixenet Cordon Negro Cava Gift Pack
Rolet Cremant du Jura Rose Brut
